title: Upwards Black Arrow
description:
An arrow, pointing up.

See the glossary for information on the term black in unicode character names.

title: North East Arrow
description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an up-right, or north-east direction.

title: Black Rightwards Arrow
description:
An arrow, pointing right.

See the glossary for information on the term black in unicode character names.

title: South East Arrow
description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an down-right, or south-east direction.

title: Downwards Black Arrow
description:
An arrow, pointing down.

See the glossary for information on the term black in unicode character names.

title: South West Arrow
description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an down-left, or south-west direction.

title: Leftwards Black Arrow
description:
An arrow, pointing left.

See the glossary for information on the term black in unicode character names.

title: North West Arrow
description: An arrow pointing diagonally in an up-left, or north-west direction.

title: Up Down Arrow
description: A vertical line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing up and down.

title: Left Right Arrow
description: A horizontal line with arrowheads on both ends, pointing left and right.

title: Leftwards Arrow with Hook
description: An arrow pointing to the left, with a curved hook at the other end. Similar in appearance to a sideways U Turn symbol, or a reply icon in an email application.

title: Rightwards Arrow with Hook
description: An arrow pointing to the right, with a curved hook at the other end. Similar in appearance to a sideways U Turn symbol, or a forward icon in an email application.

title: Arrow Pointing Rightwards Then Curving Upwards
description: A curved arrow pointing up.

title: Arrow Pointing Rightwards Then Curving Downwards
description: A curved arrow pointing down.

title: Clockwise Downwards and Upwards Open Circle Arrows
description: Circular arrows pointing in an anticlockwise direction. Similar to symbols sometimes used for refresh or rotate.

title: Anticlockwise Downwards and Upwards Open Circle Arrows
description:
Two arrows forming a circle, pointing in an anticlockwise direction. Similar to symbols sometimes used for refresh or rotate. May also be used to indicate a task is in progress.

Previously showed in a clockwise direction on Windows.

title: Back with Leftwards Arrow Above
description: The word "back" with an arrow above it, pointing to the left.

title: End with Leftwards Arrow Above
description: The word "end" with an arrow above it, pointing to the left.

title: On with Exclamation Mark with Left Right Arrow Above
description: The capitalized word "on" followed by an exclamation mark (!) with a double-sided arrow above it.

title: Soon with Rightwards Arrow Above
description: The word "soon" with an arrow above it, pointing to the right.

title: Top with Upwards Arrow Above
description: The word "top" with an arrow pointing up above it.

title: Fleur-de-lis
description: A decorative symbol that appears like a golden flower, but found in all manner of logos, symbols, and patterns. This symbol forms part of the World Scout Emblem, amongst other uses.

title: Japanese Symbol for Beginner
description:
A yellow and green shield symbol, called a Shoshinsha Mark. Must be displayed by drivers in Japan for one year after they receive their drivers licence.

Similar to L-Plates used to identify learner drivers in other countries.

title: Om Symbol
description: A symbol often used in relation to the religions of Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism and Jainism.

title: Star of David
description: A symbol often used in relation to the religion of Judaism. Not to be confused with the Six Pointed Star With Middle Dot emoji.

title: Wheel of Dharma
description: A symbol often used in relation to the Indian religions of Hinduism, Buddhism, Sikhism and Jainism.

title: Yin Yang
description:
The circular symbol frequently used to represent the concepts of yin and yang (also yinyang or yin-yang).

The yin and yang symbol (or taijitu) shows a balance between two opposite but interconnected forces with a portion of the opposite element in each section.

title: Latin Cross
description: A latin cross, otherwise known as a Christian cross. This cross symbol is often used as a symbol of Christianity. Similar in appearance to the Orthodox cross.

title: Orthodox Cross
description: An orthodox cross symbol, also known as a Russian Orthodox cross or Byzantine cross.

title: Shinto Shrine
description:
A shrine used for the Japanese Shinto religion. This emoji generally displays the torii, which is the gate to the Shinto Shrine. The torii is generally a red colored structure, with a curved roof section above two posts.

This icon is used on maps in Japan to represent the location of a Shinto Shrine, similar to how the hot springs emoji is the icon used on Japanese maps to show the location of an onsen.

title: Star and Crescent
description: The crescent moon and star is a symbol often associated with the religion of Islam. This symbol can be found on the flags of many countries, such as Algeria, Azerbaijan, Malaysia, Pakistan and Turkey.

title: Peace Symbol
description: A circular symbol, commonly used as a representation of peace. Alternatives include the Victory Hand, or the Dove of Peace.

title: Crystal Ball
description:
A crystal ball, as a fortune teller or clairvoyant gazes into to tell the future. Depicted as a sparkling, purple or blue crystal orb resting on a stand.

Commonly used for various content concerning magic, alternative spirituality, and (predicting) the future. May also be used for its shape or color more generally.

title: Six Pointed Star with Middle Dot
description: A star with six points, and a dot in the center. Similar to the Star of David emoji.

title: Black Universal Recycling Symbol
description:
The universal recycling symbol, featuring three arrows pointing clockwise in a triangular formation.

The word “black” in the official name is due to this emoji existing as a unicode character before the current standardized emoji set.

title: Radioactive Sign
description:
A hazard symbol for radiation or radioactivity. May appear similar to a three-pronged fan at small sizes.

Generally displayed on an orange or yellow background.

title: Biohazard Sign
description:
A hazard symbol used in the labeling of biological materials that carry a significant health risk, including viral and bacteriological samples.

Generally displayed on an orange or yellow background.

title: High Voltage Sign
description:
A symbol for high voltage, as warns against injury from electricity. Depicted as a jagged yellow bolt.

Commonly used to represent lightning, electricity, and various flashes. Also used to represent metaphorical energy and signal attention online.

Samsung’s bolt was previously white on a blue square, as an icon for high voltage.

title: White Medium Star
description:
A classic, five-point gold star.

Commonly used for various metaphorical senses of star (e.g., for fame, success, excellence, reviews). Also used for emphasis or flair. Occasionally used for astronomical stars.

Not to be confused with ğŸ’« Dizzy, ğŸŒŸ Glowing Star, ğŸŒ  Shooting Star, or âœ¨ Sparkles, though their applications may overlap.

Samsung and Facebook’s stars were once silver.

See the glossary for the term white in Unicode character names.

title: Heavy Large Circle
description: Used as an alternative to a check (tick) in Japan for a something that is correct. The opposite of an X (cross mark) for something wrong.

title: White Heavy Check Mark
description:
A check mark that displays with a white outlined appearance. Shows on most platforms with a bright green rounded rectangle or circle surrounding it.

Android previously displayed this as an outlined blue check mark / blue tick.

This emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, possibly in an attempt to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark.

title: Ballot Box with Check
description:
A checkbox showing a check mark inside the box. Not to be confused with the similarly named Ballot Box With Ballot emoji.

This emoji is not supported in Twitter names, possibly in an attempt to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark.

title: Heavy Check Mark
description:
A thick check mark / tick displayed on some platforms in a handwritten style. Generally displayed in black. Commonly used in lists to signify completed tasks or verification of a statement of fact.

Previously shown in red on Samsung and green on Google and Microsoft. 

Note: this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.

See also: âœ… Check Mark Button, â˜‘ï¸ Check Box with Check.

title: Heavy Multiplication X
description: A large multiplication symbol, as used in mathematics.

title: Cross Mark
description: A large red cross mark, displayed in the shape of a letter X and similar to a multiplication sign.

title: Negative Squared Cross Mark
description: A cross mark that displays with a white outlined appearance. Shows on most platforms with a bright green rounded rectangle or circle surrounding it.

title: Heavy Plus Sign
description: A large plus / addition symbol, as used in mathematics.

title: Heavy Minus Sign
description: A large minus symbol, as used in mathematics.

title: Heavy Division Sign
description: A large division symbol, as used in mathematics.

title: Curly Loop
description:
A curled loop, which is shown in black on most platforms. Previously displayed as a blue ribbon on Samsung devices.

Similar to the Double Curly Loop but with only a single loop.

title: Double Curly Loop
description:
Two curly loops, which represent a reel-to-reel tape recorder. Used as a symbol for voicemail on many phones.

A variation of this logo is used by Free Dial, a toll-free telephone number by NTT in Japan.

title: Part Alternation Mark
description:
Used in traditional Japanese music such as Noh or Renga, to indicate the start of a song. More specifically, the part alternation mark is displayed where the singer’s part begins.

This symbol looks sort of like a lopsided capital M; or a rollercoaster track showing a dip, and then a drop off to the right.

title: Eight Spoked Asterisk
description: Used in a similar manner to a regular * asterisk character but tends to be shown in a similar vertical alignment to a • bullet point. The eight spoked asterisk has both a âœ³ï¸ text and âœ³ï¸ emoji presentation available on most platforms.

title: Eight Pointed Black Star
description:
A star with eight points, that is commonly shown in orange, and for some reason, with only four points.

See the glossary for information on the term black in unicode character names.

title: Sparkle
description:
Often used as a decorative bullet-point, the sparkle has both a â‡ï¸ text and â‡ï¸ emoji presentation available on most platforms.

Like with the âœ¨ Sparkles emoji, an icon similar to the four-point star design used to represent this emoji by several vendors (e.g. Apple, Microsoft) is often used within tech platforms to represent a feature that utilizes artificial intelligence.

title: Double Exclamation Mark
description: Two large red exclamation mark (!) symbols placed side-by-side (!!).

title: Exclamation Question Mark
description: A large red exclamation mark (!) and a large red question mark symbol (?) placed side-by-side (!?).

title: Black Question Mark Ornament
description: A large red question mark (?) symbol emoji.

title: White Question Mark Ornament
description: A large white question mark (?) symbol emoji.

title: White Exclamation Mark Ornament
description: A large white exclamation mark (!) symbol emoji.

title: Heavy Exclamation Mark Symbol
description: A large red exclamation mark (!) symbol emoji.

title: Wavy Dash
description: Just like a regular dash (hyphen), sometimes used in Asian character sets in the same way a â€“ or â€” is used in latin character sets.

title: Copyright Sign
description: A copyright symbol, a circled capital letter C for copyright.

title: Registered Sign
description: A registered trademark symbol, a circled capital letter R for registered.

title: Trade Mark Sign
description: A trademark symbol, the letters TM displayed after a word that is trademarked.

title: Hundred Points Symbol
description:
100 emoji: the number one-hundred, written in red, underlined twice for emphasis.

Originating from the number 100 written on a school exam or paper to indicate a perfect score of 100 out of 100.  Teachers in Japan may also use a stamp in addition to the 100 mark, to indicate that a student has performed very well.

This 100 emoji is commonly used as a shorthand for 100%, with the usage meaning “keep it real” or a similar sentiment. A 100 emoji can be used to express pride or general acceptance of an idea.

In Snapchat, the 100 emoji appearing next to a fire emoji indicates a 100 day Snapstreak.

title: No One Under Eighteen Symbol
description:
The number eighteen with a red stroke through it, indicating a location where a person must be aged 18 or above to enter. Often used online to indicate adult or NSFW content.

Google's design includes the text "under" above the number eighteen.

The Samsung version of this emoji previously displayed the number 19. This may have been due to the practice of counting the first year of life as one instead of zero in parts of East Asia such as South Korea (the location of the Samsung Headquarters).

title: Input Symbol for Latin Capital Letters
description: A symbol showing the capital letters A, B, C and D. Intended to be used on a software keyboard, or other input screen to toggle capital letter input.

title: Input Symbol for Latin Small Letters
description: A symbol showing the lowercase letters a, b, c and d. Intended to be used on a software keyboard, or other input screenÂ toÂ toggle lowercaseÂ letter input.

title: Input Symbol for Numbers
description: A symbol showing the numbers 1, 2, 3 and 4. Intended to be used on a software keyboard, or other input screen to enable numeric input, as opposed to alphabetical or symbol input.

title: Input Symbol for Symbols
description:
A symbol showing the followingÂ glyphs:Â ã€’ (Japanese postal mark), ğ…˜ğ…¥ğ…® (music note), & (ampersand, or sometimes an @ symbol)Â and % (percentage sign).

Intended to be used on a software keyboard, or other input screen to enable symbolÂ input, as opposed toÂ alphabeticalÂ orÂ numericÂ input.

title: Input Symbol for Latin Letters
description: A symbol showing the lowercase letters a, b, c and d. Intended to be used on a software keyboard, or other input screen to enable alphabetical input, as opposed to numeric or symbol input.

title: Negative Squared Latin Capital Letter A
description: A symbol representing Blood Type A. Displayed as the letter A on a red background.

title: Negative Squared AB
description: A symbol representing Blood Type AB. Displayed as the letters AB on a red background.

title: Negative Squared Latin Capital Letter B
description:
A symbol representing Blood Type B. Displayed as the letter B on a red background.

Sometimes used online to replace the letter C at the start of words in reference to the Bloods street gang's practice of turning words like cool into bool. This has expanded in some instances to starting any word with the letter B, or more specifically, this emoji which makes it more ğŸ…±ï¸lear that a letter has been replaced.

title: Squared CL
description: CL is what shows on the CLear button of some older mobile phones.

title: Squared Cool
description: The word cool, shown enclosed in a square. This generally displays in a shade of blue, or blue-gray on most platforms. Used as a text decoration.

title: Squared Free
description: The word free, shown enclosed in a square.

title: Information Source
description:
A lowercase letter i, enclosed in a rounded square or circle. Implemented in apps or websites to indicate that help or further information is available.

May be used as a logo for tourist information signage in a town or city.

title: Squared ID
description: The letters ID in a square.

title: Circled Latin Capital Letter M
description: The letter M in a circle, commonly used in to identify a Metro (subway, underground train) station in a city area.

title: Squared New
description: The word new, shown enclosed in a square.

title: Squared NG
description:
The letters NG, shown enclosed in a square, which are an acronym for the words No Good.

The origin of NG refers to bloopers shown during or after the credits of a live television show in Japan (known as NGs), but can be used in any field as a form of shorthand for no good.

title: Negative Squared Latin Capital Letter O
description: A symbol representing Blood Type O. Displayed as the letter O on a red background.

title: Squared OK
description: The letters OK, shown enclosed in a square. Meaning Okay, denoting approval. The opposite of the Squared NG Emoji.

title: Squared SOS
description: SOS is the description for the distress signal in Morse Code. This emoji means SOS or “emergency”.

title: Squared Up with Exclamation Mark
description: TheÂ wordÂ up with an exclamation point after it, shown enclosedÂ in a square. Originally intended to denoteÂ leveling up in a game.

title: Squared Vs
description:
A square icon with rounded sides containing the letters "VS". Generally depicted as being orange in color.

Used to represent a contest between two sides, such as in competitive sports.

title: Squared Katakana Koko
description: Means â€œHereâ€ in Japanese, referring to a destination.

title: Squared Katakana Sa
description: Translates as meaning complimentary, or free of charge. For example, a drink that is given "on the house" to a regular customer.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-6708
description:
CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

Means “moon” or “month” in Chinese.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-6709
currentCldrName: Japanese â€œNot Free of Chargeâ€ Button
description:
This emoji means to own or posses.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-6307
description:
This character translates as meaning a finger or toe pointing to indicate a certain direction.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Circled Ideograph Advantage
description: Denotes a â€œgood bargainâ€ in Japanese.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-5272
description:
Symbol for a sale, or bargain prices in Japan (“cut prices”). Literally translated, this character means to cut or divide.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-7121
description:
This means to lack, or have none of something.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-7981
description:
This Emoji means “prohibit, restrict or forbid” in Japanese.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Circled Ideograph Accept
description: The å¯ (ka) character means to allow, to permit, and to be able to in Japanese.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-7533
description:
This Emoji has two meanings.

One meaning is “request” in Japanese. An alternative meaning is “monkey” in the Chinese zodiac.

It is commonly used in Japan to denote an application form or contact information for inquiries.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-5408
description:
Means “agreement” in Japanese. More literally, it means to unite, or join together.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-7a7a
description:
This ç©º character means empty and available in Japanese. This is used in the context of an empty parking space or a vacant hotel room.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Circled Ideograph Congratulation
description: Translated from Japanese, this means "congratulations" or "pray for happiness".

title: Circled Ideograph Secret
description: The ç§˜ character means secret or confidential in Japanese.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-55b6
description:
Means “work” in Japanese.  This Emoji used to mean “open for business” and precedes business hours.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Squared CJK Unified Ideograph-6e80
description:
This emoji means “full” in Japanese, usually used to denote “full capacity” such as a gas/petrol tank on a car or pre-paid phone card.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.

title: Black Small Square
description: A very small square shaded completely black. Notably smaller than the â¬› Black Large Square, â—¼ï¸ Black Medium Square, and the â—¾ Black Medium-Small Square.

title: White Small Square
description: A medium-small-sized square shaded completely white. Smaller than the White Large Square, White Medium Square, and the White Medium-Small Square.

title: White Medium Square
description: A medium-sized square shaded completely white. Smaller than the White Large Square and larger than the White Medium-Small Square and the White Small Square.

title: Black Medium Square
description: A medium-sized square shaded completely black. Smaller than the â¬› Black Large Square and larger than the â—¾ Black Medium-Small Square and the â–ªï¸ Black Small Square.

title: White Medium Small Square
description: A medium-small-sized square shaded completely white. Smaller than the White Large Square and White Medium Square but larger than the White Small Square.

title: Black Medium Small Square
description: A medium-small-sized square shaded completely black. Smaller than the â¬› Black Large Square and â—¾ Black Medium-Small Square but larger than the  â–ªï¸ Black Small Square.

title: Black Large Square
description: A square shown in the shade of black. May be used to represent anything black.

title: White Large Square
description: A square shown in the shade of white. May be used to represent anything white.

title: Large Orange Diamond
description: A larger version of the small orange diamond emoji.

title: Large Blue Diamond
description:
A large version of the small blue diamond emoji.

Note: this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.

title: Small Orange Diamond
description: A small version of the large orange diamond emoji.

title: Small Blue Diamond
description:
A small version of the large blue diamond emoji.

Note: this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.

title: Up-Pointing Red Triangle
description: A small red equilateral triangle, pointing upwards.

title: Down-Pointing Red Triangle
description: A small red equilateral triangle, pointing downwards.

title: Diamond Shape with a Dot Inside
description:
A glyph that is used for kawaii in Japan, resembling the shape of a flower.

Google's design previously resembled a flower, while Samsung's previously displayed a white symbol on a blue square.

Note: this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.

title: Radio Button
description:
A radio button user interface element, used in form fields with two or more choices. Differs from a checkbox, in that only one response can be selected.

This emoji generally shows the on/enabled state for the radio button, with a smaller circle inside a larger outer circle.

Note: this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.

title: Black Square Button
description:
A square version of the ğŸ”˜ Radio Button emoji.

The inverse of the ğŸ”³ White Square Button.

title: White Square Button
description: The inverse of the ğŸ”² Black Square Button.

title: Medium White Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of white. May be used to represent anything white.

title: Medium Black Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of black. May be used to represent anything black.

title: Large Red Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of red. May be used to represent anything red.

title: Large Blue Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of blue. May be used to represent anything blue.

title: Face with Cowboy Hat
description:
Yee-haw! A yellow smiley wearing a wide-brimmed, brown-leather cowboy hat. Its smile varies across platforms. May convey a sense of exuberance, whimsy, confidence, adventure, or other sentiments.

Several vendors, including Apple, feature the same expression as their ğŸ˜ƒ Grinning Face With Big Eyes.

title: Clown Face
description:
A circus or birthday clown displayed with white face makeup, a red nose, exaggerated eyes and smile, and two tufts of hair (red or blue). Commonly used as comment on TikTok or other social media platforms to indicate that a person is foolish, idiotic and/or selfish.

May instead describe something that is creepy or scary. Sometimes used as an unflattering alias for Donald Trump.

title: Nauseated Face
description:
A sickly-green face with concerned eyes and puffed, often red cheeks, as if holding back vomit. May represent physical illness or general disgust. Not to be confused with ğŸ¤® Face Vomiting.

Differs from other smileys conveying sickness, including ğŸ¤’ Face With Thermometer (used especially for colds and flus) and ğŸ¤• Face With Head-Bandage (physical injury).

title: Rolling on the Floor Laughing
description:
A yellow face with a big grin and scrunched, X-shaped eyes, tilted on its side as if rolling on the floor laughing (the internet acronym ROFL). Sheds two tears and tilts right on most platforms. Often conveys hysterical laughter more intense than ğŸ˜‚ Face With Tears of Joy.

Using shown tilted leftwards, though WhatsApp's design tilts to the right.

Microsoft's design previously featured a smiley with hands and feet.

title: Drooling Face
description:
A yellow face, usually shown with closed eyes and raised eyebrows, with saliva drooling from one corner of its mouth. Often used to show desire for a person (sexy, attractive) or object (e.g., delicious food). May also represent someone is tired or sleeping.

Not to be confused with ğŸ˜‹ Face Savoring Food or ğŸ˜ª Sleepy Face.

Samsung's design previously featured a startled facial expression.

title: Lying Face
description:
A yellow face with raised eyebrows, enlarged eyes, slight frown, and long nose, indicating it’s telling a lie in the manner of Pinocchio. Like that character, Facebook's design features a wooden nose. 

May represent lying, a liar, and other concepts of deceit and dishonesty to varying degrees of intensity. Sometimes used to convey disbelief (e.g., You must be kidding) or feeling abashed (e.g., as if caught in the act of lying).

title: Call Me Hand
description:
A hand with thumb and little (pinky) finger extended, making a traditional phone-like shape. May be used in conjunction with a face to suggest “call me” (please).

Not to be confused with the sign of the horn. Commonly used as a shaka sign, which is a similar gesture at a different orientation.

title: Selfie
description: A mobile phone held up to take a selfie (photo of the person holding the phone or camera). Generally represented as a disembodied arm holding a mobile phone.

title: Raised Back of Hand
description: A raised hand, showing the reverse side of the palm. May be paired with the forward-facing raised hand emoji.

title: Left-Facing Fist
description: A fist pointing left, which may be used in conjunction with the right-facing fist to complete a fist-bump gesture.

title: Right-Facing Fist
description: A fist pointing right, which may be used in conjunction with the left-facing fist to complete a fist-bump gesture.

title: Handshake
description:
Two hands performing a handshake gesture, indicating a cordial greeting between friends or associates.

As of late 2021's Emoji 14.0 recommendations, this emoji design has multiple skin tone modifier options. Certain platforms did, however, support a small number of single skin tone options for the handshake emoji prior to 2021 (e.g. both Google and Samsung in 2017). View all handshake emojis.

title: Hand with Index and Middle Fingers Crossed
description:
A fingers crossed emoji which displays the index (first) finger crossed over the middle (second) finger. Commonly used as a gesture indicating luck, or to show desire of a favorable outcome.

This emoji was previously displayed with an additional finger on Samsung devices.

title: Pregnant Woman
description:
A pregnant woman holding her round stomach. Sometimes used in jest to represent feeling too full after overeating, as in a "food baby."

Variants include ğŸ«„ Pregnant Person and ğŸ«ƒ Pregnant Man.

Twelve modified versions of Apple's pregnant woman emoji design are featured in English artist Damien Hirst's design for the cover artwork of hip-hop artist Drake's 2021 album Certified Lover Boy.

title: Face Palm
description:
A hand shown pressing against the head of a person, commonly written as facepalm. Used to display frustration or embarrassment at the ineptitude of a person or situation.

May be used in a similar context to the acronym SMH (shaking my head), or in relation to the Picard Facepalm meme.

title: Shrug
description:
A person shrugging their shoulders to indicate a lack of knowledge about a particular topic, or a lack of care about the result of a situation. ¯\_(ãƒ„)_/¯

Displays as raised shoulders, sometimes in conjunction with raised arms and flat hands. The shrug gesture in text (emoticon / kaomoji) form is known as a shruggie and typed as: ¯\_(ãƒ„)_/¯

The Unicode character Shrug ("Person Shrugging") does not specify a gender, though it was previously shown as a woman on most platforms. See also Woman Shrugging or Man Shrugging.

title: Man Dancing
description: A man dancing, added as a gender pair for the ğŸ’ƒ Woman Dancing. Shown on most platforms in a 70s-era suit, and one hand in the air in a disco-dancing style.

title: Prince
description:
Male royalty, intended as a gender pair for the princess emoji. Shown as a man with a crown.

Not a reference to the musician Prince, however the man singer emoji on WhatsApp does show a character that bears a heavy resemblance to this artist.

title: Man in Tuxedo
description: A person dressed for a formal occasion, wearing a tuxedo. No gender is specified for this emoji. See also Woman in Tuxedo and Man in Tuxedo.

title: Mother Christmas
description: Mother Christmas, more commonly known as Mrs. Claus, is the wife of Santa Claus. Displayed as an older woman with glasses and a festive red and white bonnet. See also: Christmas emoji list.

title: Croissant
description:
The flaky, golden-brown crescent of a croissant, a breakfast pastry associated with France and Austria.

The croissant emoji went viral on Tiktok in January 2023.

title: Avocado
description: A pear-shaped avocado, sliced in half to show its yellow-green flesh and large brown pit. Ready for toast, guacamole, or millennial jokes.

title: Cucumber
description: A long, green cucumber with bumpy skin. Resembles its derived product, a pickle or gherkin, on many platforms, except on Apple and WhatsApp, which depict it with light-green, seed-y slices.

title: Bacon
description: Strips of crispy, fatty, reddish-brown bacon, as fried for breakfast. Depicted as a pair on most platforms.

title: Potato
description: A whole potato—such as a russet, used for baking, mashing, or frying—shown with a few eyes on its golden-brown skin. Not to be confused with the roasted sweet potato.

title: Carrot
description: A whole, bright orange carrot, topped with long green leaves, as if freshly plucked from the garden. Some platforms feature a longer, thinner carrot, others a shorter, more bulbous one.

title: Fox Face
description:
A friendly, cartoon-styled faced of a fox, the cunning canine, looking straight ahead. Depicted as an orange fox  face with a black nose, pointed ears, and shaggy, white cheeks.

Often used with an affectionate or playful tone (e.g., slang, foxy). Does not have a full-bodied fox emoji counterpart.

Available as an Apple Animoji.

title: Eagle
description:
A bald eagle, the majestic bird of prey with brown feathers and distinctive white head. Generally depicted facing left, with its wings outspread and talons out, as if swooping down to seize prey.

Commonly associated with the United States, whose national emblem is the bald eagle. May be used for other eagles and birds of prey (e.g., hawks).

Google’s eagle used to have its wings tucked in, as if perched on a branch. Twitter’s design shows only the bust of an eagle. Apple’s ğŸ“° Newspaper features its eagle on its masthead.

title: Duck
description:
Quack! A duck, a waterbird with webbed feet. Depicted as a male (drake) mallard in full profile facing left, standing on its legs with gray and brown feathers, a yellow bill, and its distinctive green head.

May be consumed in the form of a ğŸ— Poultry Leg. Occasionally used as a substitute for the F-word, due to rhyming and Apple's iPhone autocorrect.

Samsung’s design previously featured a yellow rubber ducky.

title: Bat
description:
A bat, the flying mammal of the night. Variously depicted as a brown, black, or gray bat, with wings outspread and pointy ears, facing forward or left.

Often used in association with Halloween, vampires, and Batman.

Google’s bat was previously purplish in color, bearing two fangs. Samsung’s bat was previously brown, and Facebook’s gray.

title: Shark
description:
A shark, a large, stealthy fish with many teeth. Generally depicted as a gray shark in full profile facing left, as a tiger, bull, or great white shark hunting in the water. Shown with a white underside and three gills, its pointed nose and teeth-lined mouth curving down to a sharp dorsal fin and long, pointed tail.

Not to be confused with ğŸ¬ Dolphin.

title: Owl
description:
An owl, the hooting, large-eyed bird. Depicted as a brown owl with its head facing forward. Shown with large, round, gold-rimmed eyes, talons, tucked wings, and horn-like tufts of feathers.

May be used to represent wisdom. Once popularly used in connection with the hip-hop artist Drake.

Microsoft’s owl previously resembled a barn owl, Samsung’s was purple.

title: Wilted Flower
description:
A flower that has wilted, or is dying. Generally depicted as a limp, faded red rose drooping over the to the right on a dried-out, green stem, shedding a petal.

May be used to express such sad sentiments as heartbreak, though sometimes with a sense of irony. Sometimes used to represent a rose or other flower, with positive connotations.

Not to be confused with ğŸŒ¹ Rose.

WhatsApp's flower suggests a wilted ğŸŒ» Sunflower; Twitter's a ğŸŒ· Tulip, as Microsoft and Samsung's previously did. Facebook's flower was previously orange.

title: Scooter
description: A non-motorized scooter, with two wheels and handles.

title: Motor Scooter
description: A motor scooter, which may be displayed as any type of motorbike with or without a step-through frame. Distinct from the racing motorcycle, which is used for sport, not transport.

title: Octagonal Sign
description:
A red, octagonal sign, often but not always shown with a white or grey rim. Used in many countries as a stop sign.

Unlike other platforms, Huawei's design for this emoji displays the word "STOP".

title: Clinking Glasses
description:
Two flutes of champagne or sparkling wine being clinked together, as done at a celebratory or convivial toast (“Cheers!”). This emoji tends to spike in popularity during New Year's Eve. 

Samsung’s design suggests two glasses of white wine. Some platforms include stylized links to mark the clinking.

See also Clinking Beer Mugs—and Bottle With Popping Cork for a refill.

title: Black Heart
description: A heart shaded completely black. May be used to express morbidity, sorrow, or a form of dark humor, but despite the color remains most commonly used for love and affection.

title: Family: Man, Woman, Girl
description: A family withÂ a father, mother,Â and one daughter.

title: Family: Man, Woman, Girl, Boy
description: A family with a father, mother, daughter, and son.

title: Family: Man, Woman, Boy, Boy
description: A family with a father, mother, and two sons.

title: Family: Man, Woman, Girl, Girl
description: A family with a father, mother, and two daughters.

title: Family: Woman, Woman, Boy
description: A family with twoÂ mothers, and one son.

title: Family: Woman, Woman, Girl
description: A family with two mothers, and one daughter.

title: Family: Woman, Woman, Girl, Boy
description: A family withÂ twoÂ mothers, oneÂ daughter, and one son.

title: Family: Woman, Woman, Boy, Boy
description: A family withÂ twoÂ mothers,Â and two sons.

title: Family: Woman, Woman, Girl, Girl
description: A family with two mothers, and two daughters.

title: Family: Man, Man, Boy
description: A family with two fathers, and one son.

title: Family: Man, Man, Girl
description: A family with two fathers,Â and one daughter.

title: Family: Man, Man, Girl, Boy
description: A family with two fathers, one daughter, and one son.

title: Family: Man, Man, Boy, Boy
description: A family with two fathers, and two sons.

title: Family: Man, Man, Girl, Girl
description: A family with two fathers, and two daughters.

title: Couple with Heart: Woman, Woman
description: Two women standing next to each other, smiling, with a love heart floating in the air between them.

title: Couple with Heart: Man, Man
description: Two men standing next to each other, smiling, with a love heart floating in the air between them.

title: Kiss: Woman, Woman
description: Two women displayed kissing, or gesturing a kiss toward each other. At small sizes this may be difficult to discern from two men kissing.

title: Kiss: Man, Man
description: Two men displayed kissing, or gesturing a kiss toward each other. At small sizes this may be difficult to discern from the two women kissing.

title: Butterfly
description:
A butterfly, a beautiful winged insect whose larva is a caterpillar. Depicted with its wings outspread, as a blue-and-black morpho butterfly or orange-and-black monarch butterfly.

May be used to represent a moth and ideas of beauty and happiness.

Samsung’s butterfly previously resembled a monarch.

title: Deer
description:
A deer, a fleet-footed, hoofed mammal whose males (bucks, stags) generally have antlers. Variously depicted as a light-brown deer in full profile on all fours facing left or as a deer face looking straight head; both depictions feature large, branched antlers.

May be used to represent elk, moose, antelope, or reindeer, especially in connection with Christmas. Most platforms display a deer in full profile. Twitter shows a deer face.

Google’s deer previously had a red nose, as Rudolph the Red-nosed Reindeer. Apple and WhatsApp’s deers are white-tailed.

title: Gorilla
description:
A gorilla, the powerful, black-haired great ape. Variously depicted in full profile on all fours facing left or as a friendly, cartoon-styled gorilla face looking straight ahead.

Most platforms' designs depict a full gorilla, as a silverback, with strong shoulders and reddish forehead. Twitter’s designs feature a black and gray gorilla face with a neutral expression and prominent forehead and jaw.

Google, Samsung, and Facebook’s designs previously featured only a gorilla face.

This emoji is considered racist in some contexts, particularly when used to disparage, insult, and abuse people with dark skin, especially Black people.

title: Lizard
description:
A lizard, a scaly reptile with a long tail. Depicted as a light-green lizard on all fours from above, generally looking left with large eyes, a lightly textured or colored back, and toes outspread, as a gecko.

May be used for a variety of wild and pet lizards.

Google’s lizard was previously brown.

title: Rhinoceros
description:
A rhinoceros, a large mammal with one or two massive horns on its nose. Generally shown in light gray with two horns, depicted in full profile on all fours or as a rhinoceros head looking left.

Resembles the white or black rhinoceros.

Apple, Google, Microsoft, WhatsApp, and Facebook’s designs feature the full animal, while Samsung and Twitter’s designs feature only the rhinoceros' head.

Facebook’s design previously featured just the rhinoceros' head, as did Google's.

title: Sneezing Face
description:
A yellow face with scrunched, X-shaped eyes sneezing or blowing its nose into a white tissue, as if from a cold or allergies. Often depicted with a crumpled-looking mouth.

May also represent someone in an emotional state wiping away tears, as at a wedding.

title: Juggling
description:
A person juggling between three and five colored balls. The person shown in this emoji wears a hat on most major platforms.

Early Twitter and Facebook designs previously displayed this emoji as a pair of disembodied hands juggling three colored balls.

title: Baguette Bread
description: The long, thin loaf of a baguette, with scoring on its golden-brown crust. A bread commonly associated with France. May also be used to denote financial success, as per the slang term "let's get this bread".

title: Green Salad
description:
An undressed garden salad in a bowl with leafy-green lettuce and other ingredients such as tomato, red onion, and black olives. Commonly associated with healthy eating and living.

Google previously displayed a hard-boiled egg, removed in 2018 to make the salad vegan-friendly.

title: Shallow Pan of Food
description:
A flat, shallow, black pan with side handles, containing saffron-colored rice, vegetables, a leg of poultry, and/or shrimp and lemon slices. Commonly associated with paella, a traditional dish from Spain. May be used for eating, cooking, dining, and meals more generally.

Apple's version of this emoji is considered to be representative of the traditional ingredients from Valencia. Samsung previously displayed this emoji as a Korean hot pot.

title: Stuffed Flatbread
description: A flatbread, like pita, stuffed with lettuce, tomato, and/or meat. Resembles a doner kebab, falafel, shawarma, or gyro sandwich, popular in the Middle East and the Mediterranean. Some platforms have red onion and cucumber. Not to be confused with ğŸ«“ Flatbread or ğŸŒ¯ Burrito.

title: Tumbler Glass
description:
A short, flat glass, as used for brown liquors like whiskey or Scotch whisky.

Apple, Google, Facebook, and WhatsApp serve theirs neat, while other platforms include ice ("on the rocks").

Samsung's glass previously featured the faint initials ONI, an apparent in-company easter egg.

title: Shopping Trolley
description: A metal shopping cart that you might find in a supermarket or grocery store.

title: Spoon
description: A silver spoon, as used to eat soup, cereal, or ice cream as well as serve food or stir drinks. Positioned at various angles across platforms. May be paired with Fork and Knife, Fork and Knife With Plate, and Bowl With Spoon.

title: Eye in Speech Bubble
description: A speech bubble showing an eye inside. When using text-to-speech on Apple platforms, this emoji is read aloud as: "Eye in speech bubble representing anti-bullying campaign". This emoji was released in conjunction with the Ad Council for the I Am A Witness campaign.

title: Left Speech Bubble
description: A left-facing speech bubble, which was included in Unicode 7.0, but not considered a standard addition for the purposes of emoji presentation.

title: Canoe
description:
A narrow lightweight water vessel that is usually pointed on both ends and made of either wood or plastic.

Generally depicted with a paddle.

title: Person Doing Cartwheel
description:
A person doing a cartwheel, representing the sport of gymnastics.

In June 2023 this emoji was at the center of a viral trend (Ba’t ğŸ¤¸ malungkot ğŸ¤¸ ang ğŸ¤¸ beshy ğŸ¤¸ ko?) based on a scene from an episode of the Philippine television drama anthology show Magpakailanman.

title: Wrestlers
description: Two people in the sport of wrestling.

title: Boxing Glove
description: A padded boxing glove, used in the sport of boxing. Usually red.

title: Martial Arts Uniform
description: A white uniform used in marital arts such as judo or karate. Held together using a material belt. Known as keikogi in Japanese.

title: Water Polo
description: A person shown in water with a ball, playing the sport of water polo.

title: Handball
description: A person playing the sport of handball, shown jumping in the air about to throw the ball. Apple's design is shown wearing protective goggles.

title: Goal Net
description: A goal net where players score points in competitive sporting events. Generally depicted as a goal net used in either field hockey or ice hockey.

title: Fencer
description: A person shown in the sport of fencing, with a Rapier-style sword, mask, and protective clothing.

title: First Place Medal
description: A gold medal, given to the person or team who comes first in a competitive sporting event such as a race.

title: Second Place Medal
description: A silver medal, given to the person or team who comes second in a competitive sporting event such as a race.

title: Third Place Medal
description: A bronze medal, given to the person or team who comes third in a competitive sporting event such as a race.

title: Egg
description: An egg, displayed as a chicken egg with a white or light brown shell. Commonly used at Easter time. See also: ğŸ³ Cooking.

title: Glass of Milk
description: A tall glass of white milk, as from a cow but also other mammals, nuts, or plants. Most platforms depict a glass filled near to the brim, but some show a glass half-full—or half-empty.

title: Peanuts
description:
The pod of the peanut, shown in its rounded, grooved, light-brown shell. Apple depicts a pair.

May be used for peanut butter as well as other edible nuts (e.g., almonds) or metaphorical ones, including slang for “crazy”, “testicle”, or to nut (ejaculate).

title: Kiwifruit
description:
A kiwifruit, or Chinese gooseberry, with its fuzzy, brown skin sliced open to show its light-green flesh, white core, and black seeds. 

May be associated with New Zealand, whose residents are nicknamed Kiwis, after the bird.

title: Pancakes
description:
A stack of breakfast pancakes, topped with a pad of butter and maple syrup oozing down its golden-brown sides, onto a plate on some platforms. 

Especially popular on Pancake Tuesday.

An alternative use for this emoji on TikTok and other platforms: to represent that someone has a flat bottom ('flat as a pancake').

title: Shrimp
description:
A shrimp (prawn), a small crustacean with a long tail. Generally depicted as a reddish-orange shrimp (as cooked) in full profile facing left, with tiny eyes, many limbs, and its long antennae curling back as its long tail curls in.

May be consumed in the form of ğŸ¤ Fried Shrimp or ğŸ¥˜ Shallow Pan of Food. Often used to represent seafood.

The antennae of Apple’s shrimp curls under its body. The body of Facebook’s shrimp is straight. Google and Samsung’s shrimp previously faced right.

title: Squid
description:
A squid, an octopus-like sea animal with ten arms. Generally depicted as a pinkish-orange giant squid, facing forward or angled to the left, with a slender, arrow-like body, small eyes, and two, long arms raised up at its sides. Platforms generally depict six arms.

Occasionally used to represent squid as a food item. Not to be confused with ğŸ™ Octopus, though their applications may overlap.

Microsoft, WhatsApp and Twitter’s squid designs are facing forward, as was a previous Google design. Samsung’s squid was previously gray.

title: Face with One Eyebrow Raised
description:
A yellow face with a flat, neutral mouth and furrowed eyebrows, its left raised higher than its right. Conveys a wide variety of sentiments, including suspicion, skepticism, concern, consideration, disbelief, and disapproval.

Its expression has notably been likened to the signature look of comedian Stephen Colbert as well as actor/wrestler Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson.

title: Dumpling
description:
A dumpling of dough and filling, as folded and pinched closed for steaming or frying. Associated with cuisines around the world, including China (jiaozi), Japan (gyoza or dango), Poland (pierogi), and Spain and Latin America (empanada).

Facebook's design previously resembled a xiaolongbao, a Chinese soup dumpling.

title: Fortune Cookie
description: A golden-brown, crescent-shaped, vanilla-flavored fortune cookie. Usually depicted with a strip of paper—on which a wise saying, lucky numbers, or Chinese vocabulary is written—peaking out of its hollow shell. Given at the end of meals at Chinese restaurants in the West.

title: Takeout Box
description: A tall, folded, paper carton, usually white, as used for takeout/takeaway food at Western Chinese restaurants. Most platforms depict chopsticks inside its open lid, labeled with a red, multi-tiered, traditional Chinese building. Also called an oyster pail.

title: Chopsticks
description: A pair of equal-length chopsticks, an eating utensil used throughout East Asia. Design and color vary widely by platform, though often red or wood-colored and with tips angled together. Featured in many platforms' Steaming Bowl of Food and Takeout Box. A counterpart to utensils such as Fork and Knife and Spoon.

title: Orange Heart
description: An orange heart emoji, often used alongside other colored hearts.

title: Sled
description: A sled, otherwise known as a toboggan or sledge.

title: Curling Stone
description: A curling stone used in the sport of curling. Generally depicted with a red handle, though WhatsApp's design features a blue handle.

title: Flag: England
description: The flag for England, a country in the United Kingdom. May show as the letters gbeng.

title: Flag: Scotland
description: The flag for Scotland, a country in the United Kingdom. May show as the letters gbsct.

title: Flag: Wales
description: The flag for Wales, a country in the United Kingdom. May show as the letters gbwls.

title: Rainbow Flag
description:
A flag with six colors of the rainbow, generally including red, orange, yellow, green, blue and purple. Commonly used by the LGBT movement as a gay pride flag, or simply pride flag and seen at Pride events.

In February 2019 misinformation was spread about a so-called "anti-lgbt emoji" which can be created using a combining character to show a black and white glyph like ğŸš« on top of the rainbow flag. This is possible with any emoji on supported platforms, in the same way keycaps are combining characters.

title: Flag: United Nations
description: The flag for United Nations. May show as the letters UN. This two letter regional indicator pair is an exceptional reservation as part of ISO 3166.

title: Pirate Flag
description: A skull and crossbones displayed on a black flag, used on pirate ships, also known as a Jolly Roger.

title: Family: Man, Boy
description: A family with a father and son.

title: Family: Man, Girl
description: A family consisting of a single male parent and one daughter.

title: Family: Man, Girl, Boy
description: A family with a single male parent, one daughter, and one son.

title: Family: Man, Boy, Boy
description: A family with a father and two sons.

title: Family: Man, Woman, Boy
description: A family with a father, mother, and one son.

title: Woman Detective
description: The female version of the ğŸ•µ Sleuth or Spy emoji.

title: Female Sign
description: A circle shown with a crossed vertical line beneath it, used as a representation for women. Often used on International Women's Day.

title: Male Sign
description: A circle shown with a diagonal arrow pointing out the top-right, used as a representation for men.

title: Staff of Aesculapius
description:
A symbol displaying of a rod with a snake entwined around the outside in a downward-spiral shape.

Associated with medicine and health care services such as doctors or hospitals. A similar and related symbol called the Caduceus is frequently used in the United States.

description: The female version of the ğŸ‘® Police Officer emoji.

title: Man Police Officer
description: The male version of the ğŸ‘® Police Officer emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji.

description: The male version of ğŸ‘± Person with Blond Hair.

description: The female version of the ğŸ‘· Construction Worker emoji.

title: Man Construction Worker

description: The female version of the ğŸ’‚ Guardsman emoji.

title: Man Guard
description: The male version of the ğŸ’‚ Guardsman emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji.

title: Man Detective
description: The male version of the ğŸ•µ Sleuth or Spy emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji.

description: The female version of the â›¹ Person With Ball emoji.

description: The female version of the ğŸƒ Runner emoji.

title: Man Running

description: The female version of the ğŸ„ Surfer emoji.

description: A female version of the ğŸ‘¯ People With Bunny Ears emoji.

title: Women with Bunny Ears
description: A female version of the ğŸ‘¯ People With Bunny Ears emoji.

description: The female version of the ğŸ’† Face Massage emoji.

title: Man Getting Massage
description: The male version of the ğŸ’† Face Massage emoji.

title: Woman Getting Haircut
description: The female version of the ğŸ’‡ Haircut emoji.

title: Man Getting Haircut
description: The male version of the ğŸ’‡ Haircut emoji.

title: Woman Rowing Boat
description: The female version of the ğŸš£ Rowboat emoji.

title: Man Rowing Boat
description: The male version of the ğŸš£ Rowboat emoji.

title: Woman Biking
description: The female version of the ğŸš´ Bicyclist emoji.

title: Man Biking

title: Woman Mountain Biking
description: The female version of the ğŸšµ Mountain Bicyclist emoji.

title: Man Mountain Biking
description: The male version of the ğŸšµ Mountain Bicyclist emoji.

description: The female version of the ğŸš¶ Pedestrian emoji.

title: Man Walking
description: The male version of the ğŸš¶ Person Walking emoji.

title: Woman Cartwheeling
description: A woman doing a cartwheel, representing the sport of gymnastics.

title: Man Cartwheeling
description: A man doing a cartwheel, representing the sport of gymnastics.

title: Woman Juggling
description: A woman juggling between three and five colored balls. The person shown in this emoji wears a hat on most major platforms.

title: Man Juggling
description: A man juggling between three and five colored balls. The person shown in this emoji wears a hat on most major platforms.

title: Women Wrestling
description: Two women engaged in the sport of wrestling.

title: Men Wrestling
description: Two men engaged in the sport of wrestling.

title: Woman Playing Water Polo
description: A woman shown in water with a ball, playing the sport of water polo.

title: Man Playing Water Polo
description: A man shown in water with a ball, playing the sport of water polo.

title: Woman Playing Handball
description: A woman playing the sport of handball, shown jumping in the air about to throw the ball. Apple's design is shown wearing protective goggles.

title: Man Playing Handball
description: A man playing the sport of handball, shown jumping in the air about to throw the ball. Apple's design is shown wearing protective goggles.

title: Woman Tipping Hand
description:
A woman tipping her hand by her shoulder as if she’s carrying a tray of drinks or flipping her hair.

This emoji is commonly used to express sassiness or sarcasm.

The earlier gender-unspecified version of this emoji, ğŸ’ Person Tipping Hand, was originally depicted as a woman across most platforms.

title: Man Tipping Hand
description:
A man tipping his hand by his shoulder as if he’s carrying a tray of drinks or flipping his hair.

This emoji is commonly used to express sassiness or sarcasm.

title: Woman Gesturing No
description: A woman with arms crossed forming an ‘X’ to indicate ‘no’ or ‘no good’. This motion is used on the TV game show Deal or No Deal to indicate ‘No Deal’.

title: Man Gesturing No
description: A woman with arms crossed forming an ‘X’ to indicate ‘no’ or ‘no good’. This motion is used on the TV game show Deal or No Deal to indicate ‘No Deal’. Intended to be gender-neutral but shown as a woman on most platforms.

title: Woman Gesturing OK
description: The female version of the ğŸ™† Face With OK Gesture emoji.

title: Man Gesturing OK
description: The male version of the ğŸ™† Face With OK Gesture emoji.

title: Woman Bowing
description: The female version of the ğŸ™‡ Person Bowing Deeply emoji.

title: Man Bowing
description: The male version of the ğŸ™‡ Person Bowing Deeply emoji.

title: Woman Raising Hand
description: The female version of the ğŸ™‹ Happy Person Raising One Hand emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji.

title: Man Raising Hand
description: The man version of the ğŸ™‹ Happy Person Raising One Hand emoji.

title: Woman Frowning
description: The female version of the ğŸ™ Person Frowning emoji. Currently identical in appearance to the non-gendered base emoji.

title: Man Frowning
description: The male version of the ğŸ™ Person Frowning emoji.

title: Woman Pouting
description: The female version of the ğŸ™ Person With Pouting Face emoji.

title: Man Pouting
description: The male version of the ğŸ™ Person With Pouting Face emoji.

title: Woman Facepalming
description: A hand shown pressing against the head of a woman, commonly written as facepalm. Used to display frustration or embarrassment at the ineptitude of a person or situation.

title: Man Facepalming
description: A hand shown pressing against the head of a man, commonly written as facepalm. Used to display frustration or embarrassment at the ineptitude of a person or situation.

title: Woman Shrugging
description: A woman shrugging her shoulders to indicate a lack of knowledge about a particular topic, or a lack of care about the result of a situation. ¯\_(ãƒ„)_/¯

title: Man Shrugging
description: A man shrugging his shoulders to indicate a lack of knowledge about a particular topic, or a lack of care about the result of a situation. ¯\_(ãƒ„)_/¯

title: Man Health Worker
description:
A man working in the field of health care. This may be used to represent a doctor, nurse, or pharmacist.

See also: ğŸ‘©‍âš•ï¸ Female Health Worker

title: Man Judge
description: A man who presides over court proceedings, wearing the traditional black gown and wielding a gavel.

title: Man Pilot
description: A man tasked with flying an aircraft, such as an âœˆï¸ Airplane or a ğŸš Helicopter, shown wearing a traditional airline pilot uniform.

title: Man Farmer
description: A man engaged in agriculture, raising living organisms for food or raw materials. Generally depicted as wearing a wide-brimmed hat and holding a crop (such as carrots or corn) or a pitchfork.

title: Man Cook
description:
A man responsible for food preparation wearing a white buttoned chef jacket and toque hat.

Usually shown with either a wooden spoon or a skillet frying an egg, though WhatsApp's design is holding a spatula.

title: Man Student
description: A man who is engaged in education. Generally depicted wearing a black graduation gown and cap, and occasionally holding a degree certificate or diploma.

title: Man Singer
description:
A man singer or rock star generally displayed with a microphone, and sometimes musical notes.

iOS and Android display this emoji as a Bowie-esque figure while WhatsApp appears heavily inspired by Prince.

title: Man Artist
description: A man engaged in the visual art of painting, shown holding a palette and paintbrush.

title: Man Teacher
description: A man standing in front of a chalkboard (aka blackboard) with the intention of teaching a class. Often shown holding a ğŸ“• Closed Book or a pointer.

title: Man Factory Worker
description: A man working in a factory setting, depicted as wearing overalls and protective headgear while holding an active welding gun.

title: Man Technologist
description:
A man behind a computer screen, working in the field of technology.

See also: ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ’» Female Technologist

title: Man Office Worker
description: A man wearing business attire. This may include items such as a shirt, tie, jacket, or headset.

title: Man Mechanic
description: A man engaged in the construction, maintenance, or repair of machinery. Depicted wearing overalls and holding a wrench. Frequently also shown wearing a billed cap.

title: Man Scientist
description: A man who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences. Generally depicted wearing safety goggles and a white lab coat while holding a test tube filled with colorful liquid.

title: Man Astronaut
description: A male astronaut or cosmonaut shown wearing a space suit and helmet.

title: Man Firefighter
description: A man professionally tasked with controlling and extinguishing fires.

title: Woman Health Worker
description:
A woman working in the field of health care. This may be used to represent a doctor, nurse, or pharmacist.

See also: ğŸ‘¨‍âš•ï¸ Male Health Worker

title: Woman Judge
description: A woman who presides over court proceedings, wearing the traditional black gown and wielding a gavel.

title: Woman Pilot
description: A woman tasked with flying an aircraft, such as an âœˆï¸ Airplane or a ğŸš Helicopter, shown wearing a traditional airline pilot uniform.

title: Woman Farmer
description: A woman engaged in agriculture, raising living organisms for food or raw materials. Generally depicted as wearing a wide-brimmed hat and holding a crop (such as carrots or corn) or a pitchfork.

title: Woman Cook
description:
A woman responsible for food preparation wearing a white buttoned chef jacket and toque hat.

Usually shown with either a wooden spoon or a skillet frying an egg, though WhatsApp's design is holding a spatula.

title: Woman Student
description: A woman who is engaged in education. Generally depicted wearing a black graduation gown and cap, and occasionally holding a degree certificate or diploma.

title: Woman Singer
description:
A woman singer or rock star generally displayed with a microphone, and sometimes musical notes.

iOS and Android display this emoji as a Bowie-esque figure while WhatsApp appears heavily inspired by Prince.

title: Woman Artist
description: A woman engaged in the visual art of painting, shown holding a palette and paintbrush.

title: Woman Teacher
description: A woman standing in front of a chalkboard (aka blackboard) with the intention of teaching a class. Often shown holding a ğŸ“• Closed Book or a pointer.

title: Woman Factory Worker
description: A woman working in a factory setting, depicted as wearing overalls and protective headgear while holding an active welding gun.

title: Woman Technologist
description:
A woman behind a computer screen, working in the field of technology.

See also: ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ’» Male Technologist

title: Woman Office Worker
description: A woman wearing business attire. This may include items such as a shirt, blouse, tie, jacket, or headset.

title: Woman Mechanic
description: A woman engaged in the construction, maintenance, or repair of machinery. Depicted wearing overalls and holding a wrench. Frequently also shown wearing a billed cap.

title: Woman Scientist
description: A woman who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences. Generally depicted wearing safety goggles and a white lab coat while holding a test tube filled with colorful liquid.

title: Woman Astronaut
description: A female astronaut or cosmonaut shown wearing a space suit and helmet.

title: Woman Firefighter
description: A woman professionally tasked with controlling and extinguishing fires.

title: Man Wearing Turban
description: The male version of the ğŸ‘³‍â™€ï¸ Woman Wearing Turban emoji.

title: I Love You Hand Sign
description: The gesture for “I love you” in American Sign Language, shown as a raised pinky (little) finger, index finger, and an extended thumb.

title: Flying Saucer
description: A flying saucer, sometimes referred to as an Unidentified Flying Object (UFO). Previously shown on some platforms with an alien at the controls and/or a beam of light emitting from the base.

title: Grinning Face with Star Eyes
description: A yellow face with a broad, open smile, showing upper teeth on most platforms, with stars for eyes, as if seeing a beloved celebrity. Color of stars widely varies by platform, though commonly gold or red. May express that someone or something is amazing, fascinating, impressive, or exciting.

title: Grinning Face with One Large and One Small Eye
description:
A yellow face with its head tilted, its tongue hanging out of a big grin, and wide eyes in a wild, cockeyed expression. Generally used to express silliness.

Commonly represents acting goofy, having fun, and partying and is usually used in a positive manner. May be used in reference to someone or something that is off-kilter.

Microsoft, and WhatsApp previously displayed a full-toothed grin instead of an open mouth with a protruding tongue, which appeared less silly and more menacing. Google's design used to show the mouth in a grimace, which also read as more disturbing than silly.

title: Face with Finger Covering Closed Lips
description:
A yellow face placing an index finger over pursed lips, as if issuing Shh! or Shush! for silence. Some platforms feature raised eyebrows. Apple’s design suggests the face is tilting back slightly. 

May convey silence, quiet, secrecy, and discreetness. May also create a sense of buzz and anticipation, e.g., an exclusive sneak peek or news scoop.

See also ğŸ¤ Zipper-Mouth Face. Joins ğŸ¤— Hugging Face, ğŸ¤” Thinking Face, and ğŸ¤­ Face With Hand Over Mouth as one of the few smileys featuring hands.

title: Serious Face with Symbols Covering Mouth
description:
An angry-red face with a black bar and white grawlixes covering its mouth, indicating it's swearing or being vulgar. Grawlixes are typographical symbols (e.g., @#$%&!) representing swear words or obscenities. Often used to convey an outburst of anger, frustration, or rage.

Most platforms feature the same eyes as on their ğŸ˜  Angry Face and ğŸ˜¡ Enraged Face.

title: Smiling Face with Smiling Eyes and Hand Covering Mouth
description:
A yellow face with a hand covering its mouth. Displays most often with smiling eyes and/or blushing cheeks, suggesting coy laughter or embarrassment, as if cheekily saying Oops!

Prior to the release of iOS 15.4 in March 2022, Apple's design featured simple, open eyes, suggesting someone gasping Oh my! in serious surprise, shock, concern, or apology. This same update assigned Apple's original ğŸ¤­ design to Emoji 14.0's new ğŸ«¢ Face with Open Eyes and Hand Over Mouth emoji.

May be used to similar effect as ğŸ™Š Speak-No-Evil Monkey. See also ğŸ¤ Zipper-Mouth Face. Joins ğŸ¤— Hugging Face, ğŸ¤” Thinking Face, and ğŸ¤« Shushing Face as one of the few smileys featuring hands.

Facebook's design previously featured open eyes, though an earlier version had smiling eyes like those in the vendor's current design.

title: Face with Open Mouth Vomiting
description: A yellow face with scrunched, X-shaped eyes spewing bright-green vomit. May represent physical illness or disgust, more intensely so than ğŸ¤¢ Nauseated Face.

title: Shocked Face with Exploding Head
description:
A yellow face with an open mouth, the top of its head exploding in the shape of a brain-like mushroom cloud. A visual form of the expression mind blown, it may represent such emotions as shock, awe, amazement, and disbelief.

Apple’s design features the same expression as its ğŸ˜¦ Frowning Face With Open Mouth.

title: Breast-Feeding
description:
A woman shown breastfeeding a baby, sometimes looking down to the infant and smiling.

This emoji supports skin tone modifiers, which apply to the mother. The head of the baby is recommended to be hidden to avoid a situation where the skin tone of the baby would only correlate to the skin tone of the mother.

See ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¼ Person Feeding Baby for bottle feeding instead of breastfeeding.

title: Palms Up Together
description:
Two hands held out together with open palms facing up, in a slightly cupped manner, as if expecting an object to be placed within them.

May also be used to represent an open book in American Sign Language (ASL), or the gesture used by followers of Islam when praying.

title: Bowl with Spoon
description:
A bowl with a silver spoon inside, as used to eat cereal or soup. Bowl color varies across platforms, as do contents, though most are empty.

WhatsApp's bowl contains tomato soup, while Google's previously contained breakfast cereal.

title: Cup with Straw
description:
A drinking cup with a straw. Depicted on many platforms as a disposable cup with a lid and bendy straw, as used to serve soft drinks at fast-food restaurants. May be used for a range of non-alcoholic beverages, including milkshakes, smoothies, juice, and to-go beverages.

Color and design vary by platform. Twitter's design suggests a glass of water, while Samsung's previously displayed a Slightly Smiling Face on a red label.

title: Coconut
description:
The hairy shell of a tropical coconut, cracked in half to show its milky-white meat. 

Google previously displayed a whole coconut alongside a half-shell.

During the summer of 2024 this emoji became associated with then-Vice President of the Untied States Kamala Harris, referencing a viral clip of a speech made in May 2023 where she stated: "You think you just fell out of a coconut tree? You exist in the context of all in which you live and what came before you.”

title: Broccoli
description: A rich green, tree-like head or floret of broccoli.

title: Pie
description:
A baked dish with a pastry crust, filled with sweet or savory ingredients. Appearance widely varies by platform.

Apple depicts a whole pie in a tin, its crimped crust scored to let out steam. WhatsApp and Twitter's designs depict a slice of cherry pie. 

Google's design previously showed a slice of pumpkin pie, as served at Thanksgiving.

title: Pretzel
description: The heart-shaped twist of a hard or soft golden-brown pretzel, seasoned with grains of salt. A snack commonly associated with Germany.

title: Cut of Meat
description:
A cut of uncooked red meat, as a T-bone or rib-eye steak, with the light, white marbling of fat.

May be used for sexual slang.

title: Sandwich
description: A sandwich, as eaten at lunch, made with lettuce, tomato, and cheese on slices of white or wheat bread. Apple, Google, and WhatsApp add a deli meat that resembles ham.

title: Canned Food
description: A can or tin of food, depicted as tomatoes or a generic green vegetable. May be also used to represent sauce or soup.

title: Giraffe Face
description:
A giraffe, the tallest animal on Earth, with spots and a long neck. Generally depicted in yellow or tan in full profile on all fours facing left, with distinctive brown spots and small, horn-like structures.

Samsung’s designs feature a giraffe face looking straight ahead. Facebook’s design previously featured only a giraffe face, as did Microsoft's.

title: Zebra Face
description:
A zebra, a horse-like mammal with black-and-white stripes. Variously depicted in full profile on all fours facing left or as a zebra head facing left with a short mane.

Not to be confused with ğŸ Horse. Some vendors implement a similar face as their ğŸ´ Horse Face.

Apple, Microsoft, WhatsApp, Samsung, and Facebook’s designs feature the full animal; Google and Twitter's designs feature a head with a short mane and black muzzle. Facebook’s design previously featured only a zebra head, as did Samsung's.

title: Sauropod
description:
A sauropod, a massive, plant-eating dinosaur with a long neck and tail. Depicted as a blue, gray, or green sauropod, as a brachiosaurus, apatosaurus/brontosaurus, or diplodocus. Shown in full profile on all fours facing left.

May be used to represent various dinosaurs. See also ğŸ¦– T-Rex.

May also be used to call a person a dinosaur, i.e. imply that they are old-fashioned or out-of-touch with modern sentiments.

Apple, Google and Samsung's sauropods resemble a brachiosaurus. Samsung’s sauropod was previously green, Facebook’s previously displayed only a green head.

title: T-Rex
description:
A Tyrannosaurus rex, a massive, meat-eating dinosaur with huge jaws, tiny arms, and a long tail. Depicted as a green tyrannosaur standing on its hind lefts facing left, often with a textured back, sharp teeth, and clawed toes.

May be used to represent various dinosaurs, including raptors. See also ğŸ¦• Sauropod.

May also be used to call a person a dinosaur, i.e. imply that they are old-fashioned or out-of-touch with modern sentiments.

Google’s T-rex used to look somewhat like a velociraptor, though the design has since changed. Samsung’s T-Rex was previously red, Microsoft's brown, and Facebook’s only a green head with open jaws.

title: Cricket
description:
A cricket, a hopping insect that makes a chirping sound. Depicted as a brown or green cricket in full profile on its six legs facing left, with long antennae and large, bent back legs.

May resemble or be used to represent a grasshopper (including locusts) and other bugs. May also be used to represent metaphorical crickets, or "silence," as of a disapproving or uninterested audience.

Not to be confused with ğŸ Cricket Game, the sport.

Google's cricket was previously green.

title: Face with Monocle
description:
A yellow face with furrowed eyebrows wearing a monocle. Usually depicted with a small, intent frown and head slightly upturned, as if in careful inspection.

May show that someone is pondering, considering, or questioning something, sometimes with a sense of skeptical or ironic observation or encouraging a closer look at some content. May convey a sense of sophistication or smug intelligence, e.g., smarty-pants.

title: Person
description:
An adult with no gender specified. This emoji may be used to talk about adults in a gender-inclusive way.

Variants include ğŸ‘© Woman and ğŸ‘¨ Man.

title: Child
description:
A child with no gender specified. This emoji may be used to talk about children in a gender-inclusive way.

Variants include ğŸ‘§ Girl and ğŸ‘¦ Boy.

title: Older Adult
description:
An older adult with no gender specified. This emoji may be used to talk about older adults in a gender-inclusive way.

Variants include ğŸ‘´ Older Man or ğŸ‘µ Older Woman. See also ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦³ Person with White Hair, which is similar, though is shown with white hair and without wrinkles on most platforms.

title: Bearded Person
description:
A person with a beard.

This emoji may be used to talk about bearded people in a gender-inclusive way. It was approved in 2017. Gendered variants of this emoji were approved three years later.

Variants include ğŸ§”‍â™‚ï¸ Man with a Beard and ğŸ§”‍â™€ï¸ Woman with a Beard, both approved in 2020.

title: Person with Headscarf
description: A person (generally depicted as a woman) wearing a headscarf. While the type of  headscarf is not specified, this is most commonly displayed as a woman wearing a hijab.

title: Person in Steamy Room
description:
A person in a sauna, usually with a towel or robe and sometimes holding a ladle for pouring water on hot stones to create the steamy environment.

Popular in Finland, where people sauna in the nude.

title: Person Climbing
description:
A rock climber, shown climbing up a rock formation. Some platforms show the climber with a helmet and/or rope. The Emojipedia Sample image was created with assistance from World Champion Rock Climber Sasha DiGiulian.

Variations exist for ğŸ§—‍â™€ï¸ Woman Climbing and ğŸ§—‍â™‚ï¸ Man Climbing.

title: Mage
description: A person who wields magical powers derived from supernatural or occult sources.

title: Fairy
description:
A magical humanoid creature found in myths and fantasy stories. Generally depicted as having insect-inspired wings, it can also be assumed to be quite diminutive in size.

This emoji supports skin tones, and variations that are female or male.

title: Merperson
description:
A merperson who may be referred to as merfolk or merpeople in plural. May be used for the display of a mermaid, mergirl, merwoman, or merman.

Occasional shown wielding a trident.

title: Elf
description: Creatures with pointed ears and human-like faces. Female and male elves are available.

title: Genie
description:
A supernatural being, which is generally shown to be imprisoned within a bottle or lamp. May be capable of granting wishes when summoned. Variations exist for a female genie or male genie.

Several vendors' design for this emoji is highly reminiscent of The Genie character from Disney's Aladdin films.

title: Zombie
description:
A reanimated human, often found in works of horror fiction. May have a female or male appearance.

May be used to refer to someone who appears listless, apathetic, or unresponsive to their surroundings.

May also be used to refer to a person who attempts to resume communications after previously ghosting out of a conversation.

title: Brain
description:
A human brain, shown in pink on most platforms. Used to indicate thinking or the human mind.

On platforms such as TikTok an alternative meaning of this emoji is to represent 'giving head' (NSFW meanings).

title: Person in Lotus Position
description:
A sitting person with their eyes closed and their legs crossed in the lotus position. 

Can be used to broadly represent yoga, meditation, relaxation, or calmness.

title: Kiss: Woman, Man
description: A woman and a man displayed kissing, or gesturing a kiss toward each other.

title: Couple with Heart: Woman, Man
description: A woman and a man standing next to each other, smiling, with a love heart floating in the air between them.

title: Hedgehog
description:
A hedgehog. A small, spiny mammal sometimes kept as a pet. Generally depicted in full profile on all fours facing left, with a round, brown body covered with spines and a light-brown face and underside.

Sometimes used to represent a porcupine or echidna.

Twitter's design has always been a hedgehog facing forward. Google's design originally featured a hedgehog facing forward, though it was changed to full profile with Android 11.0. Facebook’s design previously featured a hedgehog on its back, rolled up in a ball.

title: Vampire
description:
