A vampire shown wearing a dark cape, and with pointed fangs. This emoji supports skin tones, and variations that are female or male.

May be used to call someone an "energy vampire", i.e. a person whose actions leave others exhausted or drained of energy

title: Firecracker
description:
A firecracker, as lit on Chinese New Year, New Year's Eve, or Independence Day. Depicted as a red tube with a burning fuse, sometimes lined with gold rings at its top and base.

Often used with ğŸ† Fireworks and ğŸ‡ Sparkler for various celebrations and holidays. Also applied to figurative senses of fire, e.g., slang hot, on fire (“excellent”).

While it may resemble a stick of dynamite on some platforms, several vendor designs, such as Google and Twitter's, suggest the emoji is modeled after traditional Chinese firecrackers, as are strung together and lit on such occasions as Chinese New Year.

title: Moon Cake
description: The round, golden-brown pastry of a Chinese mooncake, a traditional delicacy and lunar symbol of the Mid-Autumn Festival. Many platforms feature a design or character imprinted on the crust, and depict a slice cut out to show a brown paste with a duck egg yolk inside. Twitter displays the Chinese character for “fall/autumn” or “harvest” (ç§‹) on top.

title: Red Gift Envelope
description:
A red envelope, as gifted with money on Chinese New Year or on other joyous occasions, such as weddings, in Chinese and some other Asian cultures around the world.

Depicted as a red, vertical envelope with a gold design, typically featuring the Chinese character ç¦ (fú, “good fortune, luck, happiness"). Google’s design previously featured the character upside down, indicating “good luck arrives.”

Often used to celebrate and wish good fortune on Chinese New Year (Lunar New Year, Spring Festival). Also used to represent gifts, celebration, Chinese culture, and the color red more generally.

title: Woman in Lotus Position
description:
A sitting woman with their eyes closed and their legs crossed in the lotus position. 

Can be used to broadly represent yoga, meditation, relaxation, or calmness.

title: Woman Fairy
description: A magical female creature found in myths and fantasy stories. Generally depicted as having insect-inspired wings, it can also be assumed to be quite diminutive in size.

title: Woman Elf
description: A female creature with pointed ears and a human-like face.

title: Man Mage
description:
A man who wields magical powers derived from supernatural or occult sources.

May also be referred to as a wizard, warlock, or sorcerer.

title: Man Fairy
description: A magical male creature found in myths and fantasy stories. Generally depicted as having insect-inspired wings, it can also be assumed to be quite diminutive in size.

title: Woman Vampire
description: A female vampire shown wearing a dark cape, and with pointed fangs.

title: Man Elf
description: A male creature with pointed ears and a human-like face.

title: Woman in Steamy Room
description:
A woman in a sauna, usually with a towel or robe and sometimes holding a ladle for pouring water on hot stones to create the steamy environment.

Apple and Samsung's designs are also wearing a towel around their head.

title: Man Zombie
description: A reanimated human man, often found in works of horror fiction.

title: Mermaid
description: The female version of the ğŸ§œ Merperson emoji.

title: Woman Mage
description: A woman who wields magical powers derived from supernatural or occult sources. May also be referred to as a witch, enchantress, or sorceress.

title: Man Genie
description: A supernatural male being, which is generally shown to be imprisoned within a bottle or lamp. May be capable of granting wishes when summoned.

title: Man in Lotus Position
description:
A sitting man with their eyes closed and their legs crossed in the lotus position. 

Can be used to broadly represent yoga, meditation, relaxation, or calmness.

title: Merman
description: The male version of the ğŸ§œ Merperson emoji.

title: Man in Steamy Room
description: A man in a sauna, usually with a towel or robe and sometimes holding a ladle for pouring water on hot stones to create the steamy environment.

title: Man Climbing
description:
A male rock climber, shown climbing up a rock formation. Some platforms show the climber with a helmet, and/or rope.

Variations exist for ğŸ§—‍â™€ï¸ Woman Climbing and ğŸ§— Person Climbing.

title: Woman Genie
description: A supernatural female being, which is generally shown to be imprisoned within a bottle or lamp. May be capable of granting wishes when summoned.

title: Woman Zombie
description: A reanimated human woman, often found in works of horror fiction.

title: Woman Climbing
description:
A female rock climber, shown climbing up a rock formation. Some platforms show the climber with a helmet, and/or rope.

Variations exist for ğŸ§—‍â™‚ï¸ Man Climbing and ğŸ§— Person Climbing.

title: Man Vampire
description: A male vampire shown wearing a dark cape, and with pointed fangs.

title: Emoji Component Red Hair
description: An emoji component displaying a person’s red hair. Intended for use within emoji sequences.

title: Emoji Component White Hair
description: An emoji component displaying a person's white hair. Intended for use within emoji sequences.

title: Emoji Component Curly Hair
description: An emoji component displaying a person's curly hair. Intended for use within emoji sequences.

title: Emoji Component Bald
description: An emoji component displaying a person's bald head. Intended for use within emoji sequences.

title: Test Tube
description:
A test tube, as used to conduct chemical experiments in a laboratory. Depicted as a clear cylinder, open at one end and containing a green liquid. Positioned at a 45° angle.

May be used for various content concerning chemistry and science more generally. May also represent other liquids, such as potions or medicines, as well metaphorical laboratories and experiments.

Some platforms include volume markings or display the liquid as bubbling. WhatsApp’s design features a blue liquid.

title: Petri Dish
description:
A petri dish, as used to culture microbes. Depicted as a clear, shallow cylinder with a red, blue, or green growth medium, such as agar, with splotches of variously colored cells, like bacteria.

May be used for various content concerning biology and science more generally. May also be used to represent germs and other microorganisms.

Samsung’s design features a lid, while Google’s design previously featured a dropper.

title: DNA Double Helix
description:
The double helix of DNA, the genetic blueprint for life. Color and orientation vary across platforms, but positioned at a 45° angle and in multiple, bright colors to represent the molecule’s spiraling, ladder-like structure.

May be used for various content concerning biology, genetics, and science more generally. May also be used for various content concerning literal or figurative life and evolution.

title: Compass
description:
A magnetic compass, as used for navigation. Generally depicted in a silver or gold case with a compass rose and a red-tipped needle. Commonly used for various content concerning traveling and exploring as well as metaphorical compasses (e.g., moral compass).

Facebook’s markings include the initials of the four cardinal directions, north, south, east, and west. Not to be confused with various clock or timepiece emojis.

title: Abacus
description:
An abacus, an ancient tool used to count and calculate by moving beads. Depicted as a wooden frame with four or more rows or columns of variously positioned and colored beads.

Used for various content concerning mathematics and science (education) as well as calculations, counting, and numbers more generally.

Designs from Apple and Facebook resemble a Chinese abacus (suanpan), as did a previous Microsoft design. By one reckoning, Apple’s red-beaded design displays the number 108 and Emojipedia's, 12,031,981.

title: Fire Extinguisher
description:
A fire extinguisher, as used to put out small fires. Depicted as a red tank with a black hose and pressure gauge. Most platforms include an image of a flame on a white label.

Commonly used for various content concerning fire safety, emergencies, and literal and figurative fires.

title: Bone
description:
A bone which may be used for a dog to chew on, or as a part of the human body. The type of bone is not specified.

May be used to represent the NSFW term "to bone".

title: Leg
description: A human leg, shown detached from a human body. Displayed from the thigh and may include the foot.

title: Foot
description: A human foot shown with five toes and may include part or all of the ankle. Shown on Apple platforms as the sole of a foot.

title: Tooth
description: A single tooth, like those found in your mouth. Shown as a premolar across all major emoji vendors.

title: Kangaroo
description:
A kangaroo, a marsupial with a large tail and legs. Depicted in yellowish-brown in full profile facing left with large, pointed ears, shown either resting on its hind legs and tail or jumping.

Commonly used in connection with Australia, where the animal is found.

title: Llama
description:
A llama, a long-necked, camel-like animal, native to South America and used for transport and wool. Depicted as a shaggy white, light-brown, or multicolored llama in full profile on all fours facing left.

May be used to represent an alpaca or related animals.

title: Peacock
description:
A peacock, the male bird that displays a large, fan-like, iridescent tale. Depicted facing forward standing on its legs, with a blue body and green tail feathers outspread.

Sometimes used to suggest something is beautiful or proud. Also sometimes used to accent a peacock-like color or pattern.

title: Hippopotamus
description:
A hippopotamus, a squat water mammal with huge jaws. Generally depicted in gray or tan in full profile facing left.

Google’s design used to feature a purple, cartoon-styled hippopotamus face. Facebook’s hippopotamus is opening massive jaws, revealing tusks.

title: Parrot
description:
A parrot, a brightly colored bird known for its ability to mimic speech. Depicted in full profile facing left. Resembles a green lovebird with red and yellow wings on some platforms and a scarlet macaw with blue and yellow wings on others.

Can be used to represent various parrots or birds in general. May also be used to talk about mimicking.

Facebook’s parrot is orange with blue-tipped wings. Google's parrot was previously a scarlet macaw perched on a branch.

title: Raccoon
description:
A raccoon, a nocturnal mammal with a mask around its eyes. Generally depicted as a friendly, cartoon-styled, gray raccoon face looking straight ahead, with black-and-white markings around its eyes and pointed ears and cheeks.

Apple and WhatsApp’s designs feature a raccoon in full profile on all fours facing left with a striped, bushy tail.

title: Lobster
description:
A lobster, a large crustacean with a prominent tail and pincers. Depicted as a reddish-orange lobster (as cooked) from above, with a long body and tail, short, tentacle-like eyes, and ten legs, the top of which are very large pincers.

Often used to represent lobster as food as well as in connection to the US state of Maine.

In its release year of 2018, Emojipedia’s original sample image was criticized as anatomically incorrect but was shortly after resolved. That year, the transgender community embraced the lobster as a symbol for their efforts for Transgender Flag emoji.

Samsung, WhatsApp, and Facebook’s lobsters are depicted at an angle.

title: Mosquito
description:
A mosquito, a type of bloodsucking fly. Depicted as a brown or black mosquito on its six, long legs, with wings, long abdomen, and needle-like mouth. Variously shown from above or facing left.

May be used to represent various insects, other bugs and bug bites, and insect-borne diseases (e.g., malaria). May also be used for metaphorical pests.

Facebook’s mosquito has a red abdomen, as if filled with blood.

title: Leafy Green
description: A head of a rich green leaf vegetable, usually shown with white stalks. May be used to represent a variety of greens, including romaine lettuce, chard, and Chinese cabbage like bok choy, as commonly cooked in Asian cuisines.

title: Mango
description: The ripe fruit of a tropical mango. Variously depicted in shades of yellow, red, orange, and green with a single, green leaf and stem.

title: Bagel
description:
The brown bread of a bagel, shown sliced in two halves. Some platforms depict seeds, as sesame or poppy, and a schmear of cream cheese, with the bagel assembled as a sandwich. May resemble the Doughnut at small sizes.

After complaints, Apple updated the bagel emoji design during the iOS 12.1 beta cycle.

title: Cupcake
description: An individual cupcake in a liner topped with a swirl of frosting and sprinkles. The style of cupcake widely varies across platforms. The cake may be sponge or chocolate, the frosting pink or white, and the sprinkles rainbow or red.

title: Lacrosse Stick and Ball
description: A stick and ball used in the sport of lacrosse. The ball is usually depicted as either orange or white, while the stick's color varies across emoji designs.

title: Softball
description: A softball, which is differentiated from a baseball by size (it is larger, though hard to tell in emoji form) and color (yellow, not white).

title: Skateboard
description:
A skateboard emoji, usually showing the board from the top.

Twitter's design shows the under-side of the board, as did a previous Microsoft design.

Emojipedia's sample image was modelled after Tony Hawk's skateboard.

title: Flying Disc
description: A flying disc, more commonly known as a frisbee. Used in the sport of Ultimate or disc golf.

title: Jigsaw Puzzle Piece
description:
A single piece of a jigsaw puzzle, shown with two tabs and two blanks.

Usually shown as a plain green puzzle piece, though color and imagery does vary.

title: Toolbox
description:
A red box for holding and transporting tools, such as a hammer and wrench. Generally depicted as latched shut with silver hardware and a black handle.

Commonly used for literal or metaphorical tools, toolkits, and building.

WhatsApp's design includes a hammer in front. Google’s design was previously shown as open with two wrenches and a pair of pliers.

title: Brick
description:
A red brick or bricks. Depicted in a loose stack, a single object with holes, or as built into wall, as of a house, school, or other structure.

Commonly used for various content concerning building and construction. May also be used for figurative bricks, e.g., slang brick, “extremely cold (weather).”

title: Magnet
description:
A horseshoe magnet, as used to pick up iron. Depicted at various angles in red with silver-tipped poles.

Commonly used for various content concerning literal and figurative magnetism and attraction. May also be used in various science-related contexts more generally.

Twitter’s design features two electric bolts coming from its poles. WhatsApp’s horseshoe is half blue, denoting an opposite magnetic pole.

title: Luggage
description:
A suitcase or bag, as used for traveling. Most platforms depict gray or blue rolling luggage with an extended handle. Commonly used for various content concerning traveling or taking trips, whether for business or leisure.

Apple’s design features an old-fashioned, leather, trunk-styled case with graphic luggage labels/stickers, not to be confused with ğŸ’¼ Briefcase or ğŸ‘œ Handbag. Google and Facebook also include such stickers.

May be stored in a ğŸ›… Coin Locker or inspected at ğŸ›ƒ Customs.

title: Lotion Bottle
description:
A bottle of lotion for the skin, such as moisturizer or sunscreen (sunblock). May be used for other hygienic liquids, including shampoo and body wash, as well as beauty products.

Appearance varies across platforms, but commonly depicted in white and gold colors. Some designs also include a droplet icon on the bottle.

Most platforms feature a bottle with a pump, though others previously displayed a cylinder with a cap.

title: Ball of Yarn
description:
A ball of yarn, as used to knit a scarf. Color varies across platforms, but often depicted in green, blue, or magenta and shown with an end unraveling. Sometimes depicted with a pair of knitting needles stuck in the ball.

Commonly used for various content concerning knitting and needlework (e.g., sewing, crocheting), clothing and fashion, arts and crafts, cold weather, and cats.

title: Safety Pin
description:
A silver safety pin or clip, as used to fasten fabric. Generally shown clasped at a 45° angle, with its spring at the lower left.

May be used for various content concerning arts, crafts, and sewing. Not to be confused with ğŸ“ Paperclip.

title: Teddy Bear
description:
A classic teddy bear, as snuggled by a child when going to sleep.

Depicted as a brown, stuffed toy bear, shown seated with its arms to the sides, hind paw pads facing forward, and a friendly smile on its face. Google, WhatsApp, and Twitter's designs include a ribbon around the neck, while Facebook's is wearing a bow tie.

Commonly used to convey something or someone is cute or cuddly (e.g., teddy bear as a term of endearment) as well as other warm, loving sentiments (e.g., get well soon). May also be used for various content concerning toys and children more generally.

Not to be confused with ğŸ» Bear Face, though their applications may overlap.

title: Broom
description:
A traditional broom, as used for sweeping—or ridden by a witch. Shown at a 45° angle, with a wooden handle and yellow bristles at the lower left.

Commonly used for various content concerning cleaning, brushing, and figurative sweeps (e.g., in sports or awards). Not to be confused with ğŸ–Œï¸ Paintbrush.

title: Basket
description:
A basket, as used for storing or carrying such things as food or clothes. Appearance widely varies across platforms but generally depicted as woven from wicker with one or more handles. Commonly used to represent doing laundry or having a picnic.

Apple and WhatsApp’s designs, featuring a white cloth, suggest a bread or picnic basket. Samsung’s design displays green fabric, as knitted from yarn.

Microsoft’s design previously suggested a laundry basket by holding a blue garment or cloth.

Not to be confused with ğŸ—‘ï¸ Wastebasket.

title: Roll of Paper
description:
A roll of paper, as toilet paper (toilet tissue). May also be a roll of kitchen/paper towels. Depicted at various angles, with a sheet unfurling.

Commonly used for toilet paper but may also be used for various content concerning toilets, going to the bathroom, bathrooms, cleaning, or paper more generally.

title: Bar of Soap
description:
A bar of soap, as used in the shower, bath or for hand washing. Generally shown with lathered bubbles. Depicted in various colors, often pink, and at different angles.

Commonly used for various content concerning bathing, washing, and cleaning. May be used to represent the opposite of dirt or being dirty. Recommended for use to prevent the spread of COVID-19.

title: Sponge
description: A peanut-shaped sponge, as used for cleaning or bathing. Generally depicted in yellow and at different angles across platforms. Commonly used for various content concerning bathing, washing, and cleaning.

title: Receipt
description:
A white paper receipt, as proof of payment, and shown flat or curled. May be used for other financial documents (e.g., invoice, tax form). May also be used for the slang receipts, or "evidence” or “confirmation” of some feat or controversy.

Some vendors feature easter eggs. Apple’s design, for instance, displays the date of July 17 (World Emoji Day); items referencing its 1997–2002 Crazy Ones/Think Different ad campaign (misfits, square pegs, round holes); and a balance $0.00.

title: Face with Party Horn and Party Hat
description:
A yellow face with a party hat blowing a party horn as confetti floats around its head. Used for celebrating joyous occasions (such as New Year's Eve or World Emoji Day) and enjoying good times more generally.

Apple’s design features the same expression as its ğŸ˜š Kissing Face With Closed Eyes.

title: Face with Uneven Eyes and Wavy Mouth
description:
A yellow face with a crumpled mouth and a cockeyed expression, as if tired and emotional from inebriation or smitten with love. Depicted with raised or furrowed eyebrows and at least one eye half-open. WhatsApp's design features a tongue hanging out. 

Meaning widely varies, but commonly conveys intoxication or infatuation. Its dazed expression may also represent such feelings or states as bewilderment, irritation, disgust, exhaustion, wackiness, or complete satisfaction.

title: Swan
description:
A swan, a waterbird with white feathers and a long neck. Depicted in full profile facing left, with a curving neck, orange bill, black eye marking, and wings and legs tucked in, as if gliding in water.

May be used to represent a goose or, metaphorically, love, grace, and beauty.

title: Badger
description:
A badger, a stocky mammal in the weasel family with a long, pointed head. Generally depicted in full profile on all fours facing left, with a gray coat, black-and-white-striped face, and short tail.

Google’s design used to feature a friendly, cartoon-styled black-and-white badger face. Facebook’s badger is sitting on its hind legs.

title: Man Superhero
description:
A man who wields abilities beyond those of ordinary people and is dedicated to protecting the public. Generally depicted as wearing a colorful domino mask and a cape.

The Supervillain is the nemesis of this emoji.

title: Man: Bald
description: The male version of ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦² Bald Person.

title: Woman Superhero
description:
A woman who wields abilities beyond those of ordinary people and is dedicated to protecting the public. Generally depicted as wearing a colorful domino mask and a cape.

The Supervillain is the nemesis of this emoji.

title: Woman: Curly Hair
description: The female version of ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦± Person with Curly Hair.

title: Man: Red Hair
description: The male version of ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦° Person with Red Hair.

title: Man Supervillain
description:
A man who wields abilities beyond those of ordinary people who, unlike their nemesis the Superhero, uses their powers for evil. 

Google's design is similar to that of Mr. Sinister from the X-Men Marvel comics.

title: Permanent Paper Sign
description:
The symbol for infinity enclosed within a circle or square.

Originally encoded as a symbol to represent acid-free paper, this permanent paper sign was later given emoji presentation to form an infinity emoji.

May also be used by members of the autism rights movement to represent neurodiversity.

Note: this emoji is not supported in Twitter / X names, to minimize confusion with a verified checkmark. Learn more here.

title: Man: Curly Hair
description: The male version of ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦± Person with Curly Hair.

title: Woman: White Hair
description: The female version of ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦³ Person with White Hair.

title: Man: White Hair
description: The male version of ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦³ Person with White Hair.

title: Woman: Red Hair
description: The female version of ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦° Person with Red Hair.

title: Woman: Bald
description:
A woman with a bald head. Can be used to represent a bald woman or a woman with a shaved head. May also be used to represent a woman experiencing hair loss from chemotherapy, alopecia, or other medical treatments or conditions. 

Variants include ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¦² Bald Person and ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¦² Bald Man.

title: Woman Supervillain
description:
A woman who wields abilities beyond those of ordinary people who, unlike their nemesis the Superhero, uses their powers for evil. 

Google's design is similar to that of Mr. Sinister from the X-Men Marvel comics.

title: Smiling Face with Smiling Eyes and Three Hearts
description:
A yellow face with smiling eyes, a closed smile, rosy cheeks, and several hearts floating around its head. Expresses a range of happy, affectionate feelings, especially being in love. The placement of the hearts varies slightly by platform.

Apple's design features the same expression as its â˜ºï¸ Smiling Face emoji design.

title: Overheated Face
description:
A reddish-orange face with furrowed eyebrows, tongue stuck out, and beads of sweat, as if overheated from high temperatures. Number and position of sweat droplets vary by platforms. May also represent physical attractiveness (slang, hot).

Most platforms feature expressions that are variations on ğŸ˜° Anxious Face With Sweat or ğŸ˜¥ Sad but Relieved Face.

title: Freezing Face
description:
An icy-blue face with gritted teeth usually depicted with icicles clinging to its cheeks or jaw, as if frozen from extreme cold. May also represent unfriendliness (slang, cold) or excellence (slang, cool or chill).

Apple’s design features the same expression as its ğŸ˜¬ Grimacing Face. Huawei's design has a chipped ğŸ¦· Tooth.

title: Face with Pleading Eyes
description:
A yellow face with furrowed eyebrows, a small frown, and large, “puppy dog” eyes, as if begging, pleading, or yearning (possibly even in a NSFW manner, depending on the context). May also represent adoration or feeling touched by a loving gesture.

Huawei's design for this emoji includes a pair of ğŸ™ Folded Hands.

At its peak the Pleading Face was the third most popular emoji used on Twitter, and was the most commonly found emoji in tweets that include hearts. Used in sequence with pointing hands to indicate a bashful or shy pose (ğŸ¥ºğŸ‘‰ğŸ‘ˆ) particularly on TikTok.

title: Superhero
description:
A person who wields abilities beyond those of ordinary people and is dedicated to protecting the public. Generally depicted as wearing a colorful domino mask and a cape.

This base emoji does not specify a gender, but is used to create the emojis for Man Superhero and Woman Superhero.

The Supervillain is the nemesis of this emoji.

title: Supervillain
description:
A person who wields abilities beyond those of ordinary people who, unlike their nemesis the Superhero, uses their powers for evil. 

This base emoji does not specify a gender, but is used to create the emojis for Man Supervillain and Woman Supervillain.

Google's design is similar to that of Mr. Sinister from the X-Men Marvel comics.

title: Microbe
description:
A microbe, as a bacterium grown in a ğŸ§« Petri Dish or observed under a ğŸ”¬ Microscope. Generally depicted as a squiggly, single-celled microorganism with prominent cilia. Color, shape, and position vary across platforms. Commonly used to represent bacteria, viruses, and germs and disease more generally.

In 2020, this emoji became primarily used in reference to Coronavirus / COVID-19.

Apple's version of this emoji most closely represents a virus, while others from Samsung, Microsoft and Twitter appear as bright green bacteria. Other versions of this emoji also appear mainly as bacteria: Facebook's is indigo, and WhatsApp’s purple. Google’s design previously displayed five microbes in different, bright colors.

title: Salt Shaker
description: A clear glass shaker of salt with a silver cap, as paired with pepper to season food when eating at a restaurant.

title: Male with Stroke and Male and Female Sign
description:
A symbol commonly used to represent those in the transgender community. Used within the draft emoji sequence for the Transgender Flag emoji, and also given emoji presentation on Samsung devices.

Shows as a plain text character on other platforms.

title: Black Chess Pawn
description: A single black pawn used in the game of chess.

title: Woman in Tuxedo
description: A woman dressed for a formal occasion, wearing a tuxedo.

title: Yawning Face
description:
A yellow face with eyes closed and mouth wide open covered by a hand. Captured mid-yawn, this may represent having insufficient sleep, or to imply boredom with a person or topic.

Not to be confused with ğŸ˜ª Sleepy Face or ğŸ˜´ Sleeping Face, which often convey actually being asleep, or ğŸ˜« Tired Face which is tired as in "fed up".

title: Hindu Temple
description: A Hindu temple or mandir; a place of worship for followers of Hinduism. Depicted on most platforms as a red, orange, or golden building with a tall spire.

title: Parachute
description: An open parachute floating through the air with a human steering. Most platforms feature a ram-air design. Colors vary across platforms.

title: Diving Mask
description:
A diving mask with a snorkel, used for scuba diving or other underwater activities. Colors vary across platforms.

ğŸ¥½ Goggles is similar in design, but used primarily to represent safety goggles rather than swimming goggles.

title: Diya Lamp
description:
A lamp made of brass or clay, displayed with a lit wick leading into oil or ghee.

Commonly used in Hindu, Sikh, Jain and Zoroastrian religious festivals such as Diwali.

title: Axe
description: An axe with a wooden handle and a metal blade. On many platforms the blade is red, like a fire axe.

title: Razor
description:
A safety razor, depicted in various colors across platforms.

Previously shown as a straight razor by Microsoft, WhatsApp, and JoyPixels.

title: White Heart
description:
A white heart emoji, used for love and affection. Also commonly used to discuss someone passing away.

An alternative character known as White Heart Suit is also available, but not intended to have an emoji appearance.

title: Standing Person
description:
A person standing upright. Commonly used to convey awkwardness, particularly on TikTok.

Similar in appearance to ğŸš¶ Person Walking, but shown facing forward and without any motion implied.

title: Kneeling Person
description: A person kneeling down on one or both knees. May be used to represent someone in prayer, or a person resting on the floor.

title: Mechanical Arm
description: A mechanical or prosthetic arm.

title: Mechanical Leg
description: A mechanical or prosthetic leg.

title: Pinching Hand
description: A hand with thumb and index finger in close proximity. Used to suggest that something is small, or to gesture a small amount.

title: Ear with Hearing Aid
description: An ear shown with a hearing aid, worn by a person with hearing loss. The style shown in Behind The Ear (BTE), but this can represent any form of hearing aid.

title: Brown Heart
description:
A brown heart, often used discuss topics related to racial identity ğŸ§‘ğŸ½ğŸ§‘ğŸ¾ğŸ§‘ğŸ¿

The least used of the nine colored hearts (â¤ï¸ğŸ§¡ğŸ’›ğŸ’šğŸ’™ğŸ’œğŸ–¤ğŸ¤ğŸ¤).

title: Guide Dog
description:
A guide (or Seeing Eye) dog, trained to help lead a person who is blind or visually impaired. Generally depicted as a yellowish-brown Labrador Retriever on all fours facing left, equipped with a harness and handle. Many platforms additionally include a collar.

Not to be confused with ğŸ•‍ğŸ¦º Service Dog, though their popular applications may overlap.

Twitter implements the same dog as its ğŸ• Dog. Samsung and Twitter’s guide dogs have green harnesses.

title: Sloth
description: A sloth, the slow-moving, tree-dwelling mammal. Depicted as a light-brown sloth with a wide, whitish, masked face hanging from a tree branch, facing left or right. Generally shown as a three-toed sloth.

title: Otter
description:
An otter, the playful water mammal in the weasel family. Depicted as a light-brown otter on its back, with its forepaws held together and whiskered face to the left, generally with its long tail curled up.

May be used to refer to certain members of the LGBTQ community, a la the slang term "otter".

Apple’s otter is in water, holding a stone, as is Microsoft’s.

title: Orangutan
description:
An orangutan, the orange-haired ape with long arms. Depicted facing forward, with a long broad face and sitting with its legs bent. Occasionally shown scratching its head. Color varies across platforms, ranging from orange to light brown.

This emoji is considered racist in some contexts, particularly when used to disparage, insult, and abuse people with dark skin, especially Black people.

title: Oyster
description: Half of an opened oyster shell with gray, pink, or orange flesh inside. Many platforms also include a pearl in the shell.

title: Flamingo
description:
A flamingo, a waterbird with pink feathers and long neck and legs. Depicted as a flamingo in full profile facing left, standing on one leg, usually with a long, black beak.

May be used to represent summer fun or as a pink accent color.

title: Garlic
description: A single white or light brown bulb of garlic. Can be used to talk about cooking, eating, or vampire protection.

title: Onion
description: A round yellow onion. Can be used to talk about cooking, eating, or crying. Sometimes used in metaphors about layers. Might also be used in computing contexts in reference to onion routing.

title: Waffle
description: A round or square Belgian waffle, baked to a golden brown. Most platforms depict this emoji topped with a pad of butter, and some include gooey syrup running down the sides.

title: Falafel
description:
Brown spheres depicting falafel, a food popular in Middle Eastern and North African cuisine, typically made of mashed chickpeas or fava beans. Most platforms include three or more falafel with one piece split open to reveal a green center. Can be used to talk about falafel and possibly other round brown food items like meatballs.

On several platforms ğŸ¥™ Stuffed Flatbread appears to be filled with falafel, so for some users, these two emoji might be interchangeable.

title: Butter
description: A pale yellow stick of butter. Can be used to talk about cooking or eating. Might also be used in idioms or to reference something that is smooth.

title: Beverage Box
description:
Originally proposed as Juice, this emoji can be used to talk about juice or other liquids that come in boxes with straws. It can also be used metaphorically to talk about power, energy, respect, or an elusive quality that makes someone special.

While intended to be used to represent a broad selection of juices and other liquids, most vendors' designs feature a ğŸ Red Apple symbol. ğŸ‡ Grapes, ğŸŠTangerine, ğŸ‘ Peach, ğŸ’ Cherries, ğŸ Pear, and a ğŸŒ Sun with Face across other more distinct designs.

title: Mate Drink
description:
Mate is a caffeinated beverage popular in many South American countries. Green in color (from a key ingredient: the dried leaves of yerba mate) and consumed via a metal straw.

This drink is commonly referred to as yerba mate in English, and sometimes spelled maté (to distinguish from a mate, as in friend).

title: Manual Wheelchair
description:
A manual wheelchair. Most platforms show a red and black or blue and black wheelchair. Distinct from â™¿ Wheelchair Symbol, which is used as signage to indicate accessible facilities. See also ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ¦½Woman in Manual Wheelchair or ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¦½Man in Manual Wheelchair.

ğŸ¦¼ Motorized Wheelchair was approved at the same time as this emoji.

title: Motorized Wheelchair
description:
A motorized wheelchair. Most platforms show a red and black or blue and black wheelchair. Distinct from â™¿ Wheelchair Symbol which is used as signage to indicate accessible facilities. See also ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ¦¼Woman in Motorized Wheelchair or ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¦¼Man in Motorized Wheelchair.

ğŸ¦½ Manual Wheelchair was approved at the same time as this emoji.

title: Auto Rickshaw
description: An auto rickshaw, often referred to as a tuk tuk. This motorized version of a cycle rickshaw is used for transport in many regions of the world. Generally this emoji has three wheels and open sides without doors.

title: Ringed Planet
description: A ringed planet that appears with various number of rings, tilt angles, and colors across platforms. This vaguely Saturn-like orb was proposed as a stand-alone planet emoji to represent all planets.

title: Kite
description:
A kite. Usually diamond-shaped with a tail, this emoji appears in various colors across platforms.

Unlike other vendors, Huawei's design is shaped like a bird of prey.

title: Adhesive Bandage
description: An adhesive bandage used for first aid. Sometimes called a Band-Aid or band aid after the trademarked product. Sometimes called a plaster.

title: Stethoscope
description: A stethoscope with a round resonator and two earpieces. Shown in black, blue, green, or red, depending on the platform.

title: Chair
description:
A simple wooden chair.

Distinct from ğŸ’º Seat, which is generally depicted as a fixed plane, train, or bus seat, as opposed to a chair which can be moved.

May have sexual connotations (e.g., sit on my face).

In 2021 this emoji was also used on TikTok to signify laughter or approval or to create confusion for people not in the know. Learn more here.

title: Skunk
description:
A skunk, a bushy-tailed mammal that sprays a foul odor when threatened. Depicted in full profile on all fours facing left, with black hair and its distinctive white stripe running from its head down to a curled-up tail.

Google’s original skunk design bore a humorously haughty air.

title: Service Dog
description: A service animal displayed with a safety vest and lead. Differs from the guide dog as this animal is intended for detection of seizures or other “hidden disabilities”, according to the proposal from Apple.

title: Deaf Person
description: A person gesturing with their index finger between ear and mouth, used as a deaf sign in American Sign Language (ASL) and a number of other global sign languages. See also ğŸ¦» Ear With Hearing Aid.

title: Deaf Person
description: A person gesturing with their index finger between ear and mouth, used as a deaf sign in American Sign Language (ASL) and a number of other global sign languages. See also ğŸ¦» Ear With Hearing Aid.

title: Large Blue Square
description: A square shown in the color of blue. May be used to represent anything blue.

title: Man with White Cane
description: A man using a white cane as a mobility aid, presumably due to them being blind or visually impaired.

title: Large Brown Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of brown. May be used to represent anything brown.

title: Woman Standing
description:
A person standing upright. Commonly used to convey awkwardness, particularly on TikTok.

Similar in appearance to ğŸš¶‍â™€ï¸ Woman Walking, but shown facing forward and without any motion implied.

title: Woman in Motorized Wheelchair
description: A woman using a motorized wheelchair as a mobility aid.

title: Large Green Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of green. May be used to represent anything green.

title: Woman Kneeling
description: A woman kneeling down on one or both knees. May be used to represent someone in prayer, or a person resting on the floor.

title: People Holding Hands
description:
Two people holding hands, most likely due to being in a relationship.

No gender is specified for these two people, meaning they are likely to be shown with a gender inclusive design.

title: Large Orange Square
description: A square shown in the color of orange. May be used to represent anything orange.

title: Large Orange Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of orange. May be used to represent anything orange.

title: Woman in Manual Wheelchair
description: A woman using a manual wheelchair as a mobility aid.

title: Large Purple Square
description: A square shown in the color of purple. May be used to represent anything purple.

title: Large Green Square
description:
A square shown in the color of green. May be used to represent anything green.

May 2021: Sometimes shown in Twitter names in support of Taproot, a Bitcoin fork (potential feature change) that would allow additional privacy measures for transactions.

title: Yo-Yo
description:
A round yo-yo with its string coming out. It appears in various colors and designs across platforms, occasionally with a â­ Star on its side.

WhatsApp's yo-yo design displays the company's logo.

title: Large Yellow Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of yellow. May be used to represent anything yellow.

title: Large Yellow Square
description: A square shown in the color yellow. May be used to represent anything yellow, including a yellow penalty card in football (soccer).

title: Deaf Man
description:
A man gesturing with their index finger between ear and mouth, used as a deaf sign in American Sign Language (ASL) and a number of other global sign languages.

Incorrectly displays with a female design within Windows 11 23H2.

title: Deaf Man
description:
A man gesturing with their index finger between ear and mouth, used as a deaf sign in American Sign Language (ASL) and a number of other global sign languages.

Incorrectly displays with a female design within Windows 11 23H2.

title: Large Purple Circle
description: A circle shown in the color of purple. May be used to represent anything purple.

title: Drop of Blood
description: A red drop of blood. May be used to talk about bleeding, injury, blood donation, or menstruation.

title: Woman with White Cane
description: A woman using a white cane as a mobility aid, presumably due to them being blind or visually impaired.

title: Man Standing
description:
A man standing upright. Commonly used to convey awkwardness, particularly on TikTok.

Similar in appearance to ğŸš¶‍â™‚ï¸ Man Walking, but shown facing forward and without any motion implied.

title: Deaf Woman
description:
A woman gesturing with their index finger between ear and mouth, used as a deaf sign in American Sign Language (ASL) and a number of other global sign languages.

Incorrectly displays with a male design within Windows 11 23H2.

title: Deaf Woman
description:
A woman gesturing with their index finger between ear and mouth, used as a deaf sign in American Sign Language (ASL) and a number of other global sign languages.

Incorrectly displays with a male design within Windows 11 23H2.

title: Large Red Square
description: A square shown in the color red. May be used to represent anything red, including a red penalty card in football (soccer).

title: Man in Motorized Wheelchair
description: A man using a motorized wheelchair as a mobility aid.

title: Man Kneeling
description: A man kneeling down on one or both knees. May be used to represent someone in prayer, or a person resting on the floor.

title: Large Brown Square
description: A square shown in the color of brown. May be used to represent anything brown.

title: Man in Manual Wheelchair
description: A man using a manual wheelchair as a mobility aid.

title: Ninja
description:
A person dressed as a ninja with a black hood, a mask covering the lower half of their face, and the hilt of a knife or sword emerging from behind their shoulder.

The now-discontinued Microsoft ZWJ sequence ğŸ±‍ğŸ‘¤ Ninja Cat did not include the ninja emoji at all as it was developed several years before ninja was approved. It combined ğŸ± Cat Face and ğŸ‘¤ Bust in Silhouette and was only available from Microsoft prior to the debut of the Fluent emoji set in November 2021.

title: Disguised Face
description:
A yellow face with big glasses, a large nose, thick eyebrows, and a mustache. Used to represent someone in disguise.

The features of this particular disguised face are taken from the “Groucho Mask” or “Groucho Glasses,” designed in the likeness of the caricature played by Julius Henry Marx in the Marx Brothers' films. These comedic films were popular in the 1930s and ‘40s, and the mask has been a mainstay of joke shops since as early as the 1940s.

Other emoji faces in disguise include ğŸ¦¸ Superhero and ğŸ¦¹ Supervillain.

title: Mammoth
description: A brown wooly mammoth with large curved tusks. Can also be used to represent a mastodon.

title: Feather
description: A single feather slanted to one side. On most platforms it's light brown with a dark brown barred or striped pattern. Can be used to talk about feathers or birds, or to represent something that is lightweight, fluffy, or soft.

title: Dodo
description:
A brown or gray dodo shown in full profile. Generally depicted with a curved yellow beak, small wings, a fluffy white tail, yellow or orange feet, and black talons.

May be used to represent dodos or the concept of being extinct.

title: Fly
description:
A fly with a dark or iridescent green body, six legs, and two translucent wings. On most platforms, its eyes are red.

Can be used to talk about the insect or flight in general. May also be used metaphorically as an adjective meaning "cool."

title: Worm
description:
A pink or brown worm. Most platforms have more realistic designs, though Google and Samsung feature cartoony worms who are smiling sweetly.

Can be used to talk about worms or disease spread by worms. Can also be used to refer to a deceitful person. May be used to in reference to the dance move 'the worm.'

title: Potted Plant
description: A leafy green plant in pot. Plant type varies by platform.

title: Bell Pepper
description: A perfectly ripe red or green bell pepper. Can be used to talk about bell peppers or food in general.

title: Fondue
description: A red fondue pot. Most platforms show cheese fondue with fondue forks sticking out of the pot.

title: Bubble Tea
description: Bubble tea is a tea-based drink invented in Taiwan which typically contain tea, flavored milk, and sugar. Commonly served with tapioca pearls, also known as boba, in a plastic cup with a wide straw.

title: Pickup Truck
description: A red or turquoise pickup truck. Used to talk about trucks or modes of transportation in general.

title: Magic Wand
description: A wand with sparkles (âœ¨magicâœ¨) coming out of its end. Most platforms show a classic magician-style magic wand that's black with white tips. WhatsApp shows a golden magic wand tipped with a star, similar to the wand that Glenda the Good Witch uses in the 1939 film The Wizard of Oz.

title: Coin
description:
A coin shown in silver or gold. Design varies by platform, with Google and Twitter showing a ğŸ›ï¸ Classical Building and Samsung showing the number one, similar to their ğŸ¥‡ 1st Place Medal design.

Apple’s coin has the text "The Crazy Ones," a reference to its 1997–2002 Crazy Ones/Think Different ad campaign and commonly used as placeholder text in Apple icons and emoji designs.

title: Carpentry Saw
description: A long silver saw with a wooden handle. Used to represent construction, carpentry, renovation, or tools in general.

title: Boomerang
description:
A wooden boomerang with bright colors on its tips. Google and Twitter's designs show motion lines to illustrate the path of a boomerang.

Used literally to represent a boomerang. Also used to represent Aboriginal people or Australia in general. May be used to represent something that comes back or returns.

title: Screwdriver
description:
A silver Phillips-head or slotted-head screwdriver with a colorful handle. Most platforms show a red handle, though Apple's design has a green handle. Used to represent construction, building, carpentry, renovation, or tools in general.

Sometimes used in phrases with 'screw' in them like screw you or have a screw loose. Can also be used in sexual contexts due to the informal meaning of 'screw': "to have sex."

title: Ladder
description:
A wooden ladder with four or five rungs.

Used to represent ladders or the action of climbing. Also used metaphorically to represent systems through which you can climb, for example the corporate ladder or social ladder.

title: Hook
description:
A gold or silver hook. Can be used to represent literal hooks like the kinds you use to crochet or catch fish.

Also use metaphorically to talk about boxing or punching, music (the catchy part of a song), or in phrases like hook me up, hook up, getting hooked (on something), or hook, line, and sinker.

title: Elevator
description:
A symbol showing two or three people standing in a square with up and down arrows above them. Most platforms feature a simple blue and white design.

Mostly used to talk about elevators. Also used metaphorically to talk about moving or leveling up or down.

title: Transgender Flag
description: A flag with horizontal pale blue and pale pink stripes with a single white stripe in the middle, used as a Transgender or Transgender Pride flag and commonly seen at Pride events.

title: Smiling Face with Tear
description:
A yellow face with open eyes, a thin closed-mouth smile, and a single tear falling from one of its eyes. Can be used to express a wide range of emotions and expressions including gratitude, tender happiness, an attempt to look happy when actually sad, or smiling through pain. Can also be a response to something that is bittersweet.

This emoji and ğŸ™‚ Slightly Smiling Face have a similar smile, and ğŸ˜¢ Crying Face and ğŸ˜¿ Crying Cat have a similar lone tear. Not to be confused with ğŸ˜‚ Face with Tears of Joy, which has a wide toothy grin and tears coming from both eyes.

title: Pinched Fingers
description:
An emoji showing the fingers held together in a vertical orientation, often referred to as the Italian hand gesture ma che vuoi, sometimes called the "finger purse." In Italy this gesture tends to be used in disagreement, frustration, or disbelief and can mean “What do you want?” or “What are you saying?” Outside Italy anyone performing a caricature of an Italian person, regardless of context or tone, might use this gesture.

Pinched Fingers has a variety of other culturally specific uses. In Israeli culture it can mean “hold on,” “relax,” or “be patient.” The K-Pop star Yuri uses it as a signature gesture to represent a dumpling and a general warm sentiment. It can also be used to represent the act of fisting.

Not to be confused with ğŸ¤ Pinching Hand, which has overlapping senses. Both are used to represent precision when someone is making a sharp point with accompanying speech.

title: Bison
description: A brown bison shown in full profile with horns, a beard, and woolly mane. Also called a buffalo in North America.

title: Beaver
description:
A brown beaver with buckteeth and a wide paddle-like tail. Can be used in the context of actual beavers, or metaphorically to evoke qualities of beavers like working hard, as in the expression beavering away. 

Commonly associated with Canada, as beavers are a national emblem of the country. May also be used in reference to the vagina, which is an informal sense of the word beaver.

title: Seal
description:
A gray seal with dark eyes and a dark nose. Most platforms feature a design with whiskers.

Can be used to talk about seals, marine life, or cute animals in general. May also be used in phrases with 'sealed' as in sealed with a kiss, my lips are sealed, or signed, sealed, and delivered.

title: Beetle
description:
A green or brown beetle shown with antennae and six legs. Can be used to talk about beetles, bugs, or insects in general.

Not to be confused with ğŸ Lady Beetle, ğŸª³ Cockroach, ğŸ› Bug, ğŸœ Ant or other emoji representations of insects.

title: Cockroach
description:
A brown cockroach shown with antennae, six legs, and two sensory pads at its rear called cerci.

Can be used to talk about cockroaches or insects in general. May also be used metaphorically as an insult to call a person a pest, an annoyance, or to suggest they are subhuman.

title: Blueberries
description: A few ripe blueberries clustered together. Most platforms show three blueberries, and some show small green leaves coming out from behind the blueberries.

title: Olive
description:
One, two, or three green olives, either pitted or sprouting from a branch. Some platforms show a solitary pitted green olive stuffed with a piece of a pimento pepper.

Can be used to talk about olives or the color green.

title: Flatbread
description:
A round piece of flatbread with grill marks. Used to represent any type of flatbread, soft or crunchy.

Can be used to talk about corn-based flatbreads popular in Central and South America like arepa, gordita, or pupusa. Can also be used in reference to other flatbreads including naan, lavash, matzah, and pita.

Not to be confused with ğŸ¥™ Stuffed Flatbread.

title: Tamale
description: A single tamale wrapped in a corn husk.

title: Teapot
description:
A classic teapot with a wide bulbous body, a spout, a handle, and a lid. Can be used to talk about tea, tea time, or warm beverages in general.

May also be used to talk about gossip as in the expression spill the tea.

title: Hut
description: A round hut with a thatched roof. Used to talk about huts, cottages, yurts, or homes in general.

title: Rock
description:
A large rock the size of a small rock. May be considered a boulder, a rock, a stone, a pebble, or a piece of dirt. The scale and meaning are context dependent.

The color is gray or brownish gray.

title: Wood
description:
One or two stumps of wood, cut so the rings are showing. Can be used to talk about wood or building materials. 

Also used in idioms with wood like knock on wood or out of the woods. Used to caption dic pics, often alongside the expression morning wood. Sometimes used in the context of games like Catan or Minecraft, where wood is a resource.

title: Roller Skate
description: A single vibrantly colored roller skate. Colors and styles vary across platform.

title: Pinata
description:
A colorful decorated container that comes in many shapes, a piñata is filled with candy or toys. Hit to break open for celebrations such as Cinco de Mayo, this is generally associated with Mexico.

Displayed as a donkey on some platforms, and as a three-dimensional star with 6–9 points on others.

title: Nesting Dolls
description: Nesting dolls, also called matryoshka dolls or Russian dolls, decorated with bright colors including red, yellow, blue, and green. All platforms depict the nesting dolls as open, revealing smaller dolls within the bases of larger dolls. Dolls are all decorated with women wearing headscarfs. Some platforms show a flower motif on the women's dresses or aprons.

title: Knot
description:
Brightly colored rope forming a knot. Knot type varies across platform, with most designs showing a square knot, a figure eight knot, or a carrick bend. Samsung's design appears to be a carrick bend, but upon closer inspection, it is not correctly tied and would fall apart with a gentle tug. 

Used to talk about rope or knots in general. Sometimes used in the context of marriage alongside the idiom tying the knot. Also used in the kink community to talk about bondage. May be used as a stand-in for the word 'not' in emoji rebus puzzles.

title: Mirror
description:
A mirror with an ornate gold or silver frame. The shape and style of the mirror varies from platform to platform.

Used to talk about mirrors, reflection, or self-reflection.

title: Window
description:
A square or rectangular window with glass panes. Most platforms show a wooden frame with two or four panels.

Used to talk about actual windows or metaphorical windows, which often represent opportunities, perspectives, or unique points of view.

title: Plunger
description:
A toilet plunger with a wooden handle and red flange and cup.

Used to talk about toilets and clogged pipes. Also used metaphorically to talk about a mess or something that's disgusting.

title: Mouse Trap
description:
A trap used to catch a mouse, rat, or other unwanted rodent. Metaphorically used in emoji form to suggest any kind of trap or entrapment.

The style of trap shown on major platforms has a box held high with a single stick. A wedge of cheese is used to lure a mouse into the box, knocking the stick away and trapping — but not killing — the mouse.

This is distinct from other traps which kill or injure upon capture.

title: Bucket
description:
A blue or green bucket or pail. Used to talk about real or metaphorical buckets.

May be used to talk about bucket lists, kicking the bucket, making baskets in basketball, an abundance of something (like rain or money), and many other contexts.

title: Toothbrush
description:
A brightly colored plastic toothbrush with white bristles.

Used to talk about oral hygiene, daily routines, or something that is fresh and clean.

title: Health Worker
description: A person working in the field of health care. This may be used to represent a doctor, nurse, or pharmacist.

title: Judge
description: A person who presides over court proceedings, wearing the traditional black gown and wielding a gavel.

title: Pilot
description: A person tasked with flying an aircraft, such as an âœˆï¸ Airplane or a ğŸš Helicopter, shown wearing a traditional airline pilot uniform.

title: Farmer
description: A person engaged in agriculture, raising living organisms for food or raw materials. Generally depicted as wearing a wide-brimmed hat and holding a crop (such as carrots or corn) or a pitchfork.

title: Cook
description:
A person responsible for food preparation wearing a white buttoned chef jacket and toque hat.

Usually shown with either a wooden spoon or a skillet frying an egg, though WhatsApp's design is holding a spatula.

title: Student
description: A person who is engaged in education. Generally depicted wearing a black graduation gown and cap, and occasionally holding a degree certificate or diploma.

title: Singer
description:
A singer or rock star generally displayed with a microphone, and sometimes musical notes.

iOS and Android display this emoji as a Bowie-esque figure while WhatsApp appears heavily inspired by Prince.

title: Artist
description: A person engaged in the visual art of painting, shown holding a palette and paintbrush.

title: Teacher
description: A person standing in front of a chalkboard (aka blackboard) with the intention of teaching a class. Often shown holding a ğŸ“• Closed Book or a pointer.

title: Factory Worker
description: A person working in a factory setting, depicted as wearing overalls and protective headgear while holding an active welding gun.

title: Technologist
description:
A person behind a computer screen, working in the field of technology.

Usually shown working on a laptop, though Google's design appears to be using a desktop computer instead.

The laptop in Apple's design includes the Apple logo, as per a Macbook. Samsung and Huawei's designs include their company's logotype, while the designs from Microsoft, WhatsApp, Telegram, and JoyPixels show their logomark.

title: Office Worker
description: A person wearing business attire. This may include items such as a shirt, tie, jacket, or headset.

title: Mechanic
description: A person engaged in the construction, maintenance, or repair of machinery. Depicted wearing overalls and holding a wrench. Frequently also shown wearing a billed cap.

title: Scientist
description: A person who is studying or has expert knowledge of one or more of the natural or physical sciences. Generally depicted wearing safety goggles and a white lab coat while holding a test tube or beaker filled with colorful liquid.

title: Astronaut
description: An astronaut or cosmonaut shown wearing a space suit and helmet.

title: Firefighter
description: A person professionally tasked with controlling and extinguishing fires.

title: Person with White Cane
description: A person using a white cane as a mobility aid, presumably due to them being blind or visually impaired.

title: Person in Motorized Wheelchair
description: A person using a motorized wheelchair as a mobility aid.

title: Person in Manual Wheelchair
description: A person using a manual wheelchair as a mobility aid.

title: Person: Red Hair
description:
A person with red hair. This emoji maintains red hair no matter which skin tone is chosen. This emoji may be used to talk about redheads in a gender-inclusive way.

Variants include ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ¦° Woman with Red Hair and ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¦° Man with Red Hair.

title: Person: Curly Hair
description:
A person with curly hair. This emoji may be used to talk about people with curly hair in a gender-inclusive way.

Variants include ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ¦± Woman with Curly Hair and ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¦± Man with Curly Hair.

title: Person: Bald
description:
A person with a bald head. Can be used to represent a bald person or a person with a shaved head. May also be used to represent a person experiencing hair loss from chemotherapy, alopecia, or other medical treatments or conditions. 

This emoji may be used to talk about bald people in a gender-inclusive way.

Variants include ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ¦² Bald Woman and ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¦² Bald Man.

title: Person: White Hair
description:
A person with white hair. This emoji maintains white hair no matter which skin tone is chosen. This emoji may be used to talk about people with white hair in a gender-inclusive way.

Variants include ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ¦³ Woman with White Hair and ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¦³ Man with White Hair. See also ğŸ§“ Older Person, which is similar, though is shown with wrinkles and gray hair on most platforms.

title: Anatomical Heart
description:
A red anatomical heart, shown with blue or purple veins on some platforms.

Sometimes used interchangeably with â¤ï¸ Red Heart.

title: Lungs
description: Pink anatomical lungs and trachea, shown with bronchial tubes on some platforms. Used in medical contexts to talk about lung health. Sometimes used in reference to taking deep breaths, hyperventilating, or breathing in general. Also used in the context of smoking or vaping.

title: Man Feeding Baby
description:
A man feeding a baby with a bottle, sometimes looking down to the infant and smiling.

This emoji supports skin tone modifiers, which apply to the adult. The head of the baby is recommended to be hidden to avoid a situation where the skin tone of the baby would only correlate to the skin tone of the adult.

Variants include ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¼ Person Feeding Baby and ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ¼ Woman Feeding Baby. See also ğŸ¤± Breast-Feeding.

title: Woman Feeding Baby
description:
A woman feeding a baby with a bottle, sometimes looking down to the infant and smiling.

This emoji supports skin tone modifiers, which apply to the adult. The head of the baby is recommended to be hidden to avoid a situation where the skin tone of the baby would only correlate to the skin tone of the adult.

Variants include ğŸ§‘‍ğŸ¼ Person Feeding Baby and ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¼ Man Feeding Baby. See also ğŸ¤± Breast-Feeding.

title: Person Feeding Baby
description:
A person feeding a baby with a bottle, sometimes looking down to the infant and smiling.

This emoji supports skin tone modifiers, which apply to the adult. The head of the baby is recommended to be hidden to avoid a situation where the skin tone of the baby would only correlate to the skin tone of the adult.

Variants include ğŸ‘©‍ğŸ¼ Woman Feeding Baby and ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ¼ Man Feeding Baby. See also ğŸ¤± Breast-Feeding.

title: Woman with Veil
description: A woman wearing a traditional western wedding dress with a veil over their head.

title: Man with Veil
description: A man wearing a traditional Western wedding dress with a veil over their head.

title: Man in Tuxedo
description: A man dressed for a formal occasion, wearing a tuxedo.

title: Black Cat
description: A black cat shown in full profile, often with its tail curling upward.

title: Polar Bear
description:
A friendly, cartoon-styled face of polar bear, looking straight ahead. Depicted as the face of a white bear with round ears.

WhatsApp previously showed the full body of the bear.

title: Mx Claus
description:
A person, generally depicted as being older with gray hair, wearing a red Christmas (aka "Santa") hat. Does not represent any specific character in folklore. Mx Claus provides a gender inclusive alternative to ğŸ… Santa Claus or ğŸ¤¶ Mrs. Claus.

Apple depicts Mx Claus as wearing glasses, while other vendors do not.

Mx is an honorific that does not indicate gender.

title: Face Exhaling
description:
A face showing a visible breath of air being dispelled. Used to represent relief, exhaustion, or as a sigh of disappointment or displeasure.

May also be used to indicate the exhaling of smoke.

title: Face with Spiral Eyes
description:
A face with spiral-shaped eyes, commonly used to indicate dizziness, but may also represent hypnosis or other forms of disorientation.

Created in 2020 disambiguate from the ğŸ˜µ Face with Crossed-Out Eyes emoji which previously displayed spiral eyes on some platforms, but X eyes on others. This emoji will consistently show spiral eyes on all platforms.

Unlike other vendors, Huawei's design features a ğŸ’« Dizzy symbol atop this emoji's head.

title: Mending Heart
description: A heart shown with a bandage across one side; the opposite of a broken heart. May be used to indicate the process of healing, recovery, or to express sympathy for someone going through a difficult time.

title: Heart on Fire
description: A heart shown on fire, for extreme or passionate forms of love or lust. Most representative of desire or lust, this emoji may also indicate a sense of burning a past love and moving on.

title: Face in Clouds
description:
A face that appears surrounded by clouds or a haze of smoke. Ambiguous in appearance, this may represent a foggy state of mind, confusion, or even a sense of calm bliss.

May also be used to indicate the presence of smoke.

title: Man: Beard
description:
A man shown with long hair and a beard.

Note that as of late 2021, Samsung's design displays this emoji with a more gender-neutral design than that used for their ğŸ§” Person with Beard emoji.

title: Woman: Beard
description: A woman shown with long hair and a beard.

title: Saluting Face
description:
A yellow face with its right hand saluting. Used as a sign of respect.

The expression of the face of this emoji can vary across platforms, with some designs featuring a neutral face while others are shown smiling to various degrees. 

Apple and Huewai's designs notably only display half a face, likely to make the saluting hand more prominent when this emoji is viewed in smaller sizes.

This emoji went viral across Twitter in late 2022 following the news that the platform would be dramatically reducing its staff numbers as part of a company-wide restructuring following its acquisition by Elon Musk. Learn more here.

title: Mirror Ball
description: A mirror ball, also called a disco ball. A hanging sphere made up of a bunch of tiny mirrors, which reflect spots of light around a room, creating a party atmosphere.

title: Face with Open Eyes and Hand Over Mouth
currentCldrName: Face with Open Eyes and Hand Over Mouth
description:
A yellow face with open (non-smiling) eyes and a hand over the mouth, used to convey shock or surprise.

A disambiguation of ğŸ¤­ Face with Hand Over Mouth which appears to have smiling eyes on some platforms, and open/non-smiling eyes on others, creating confusion.

Appearance is similar to ğŸ¥± Yawning Face, though no mouth is visible.

title: Hand with Index Finger and Thumb Crossed
currentCldrName: Hand with Index Finger and Thumb Crossed
description:
A hand with the index finger and thumb crossed and the rest of the fingers making a fist. Can be used in various contexts to represent the fingers snapping, love, or money.

In this emoji, the index finger and the thumb form a small heart shape. This gesture, used to express love or affection, is known as a finger heart and was popularized in the 2010s by South Korean celebrities, including actors, K-pop stars, and comedians.

The same gesture may be used in the context of money to indicate a luxury or an expensive item, a lack of money, or a request to be paid.

title: Ring Buoy
description:
A round white and orange or red ring buoy with string laced through its perimeter. Also called a life preserver.

Maybe be used to talk about water, boats, and safety. May also be used metaphorically to talk about someone or something that saves.

title: Pouring Liquid
description:
A glass pouring liquid.

May be used to represent the literal act of pouring. May also be used to represent ritual libations or to honor the dead by pouring out a drink in a person's memory.

title: Coral
description: Coral as found in a reef, of varying shapes and colors. Sometimes used as a symbol of climate change due to coral bleaching.

title: Melting Face
description:
A yellow smiley face melting into a puddle. 

The eyes and mouth slip down the face, yet still maintain a distorted smile. This quality lends this emoji to sarcasm.

Can be used literally to talk about extreme heat. Can also be used metaphorically to talk about embarrassment, shame, a slowly sinking sense of dread, or feeling overwhelmed in some way.

title: Face with Peeking Eye
description:
A yellow face with its hands over its eyes and raised eyebrows. One wide eye is peeking through the fingers.

Can be used to express the duality of wanting to look away from something because it's frightening, disgusting, or embarrassing, but not being able to.

title: Dotted Line Face
description:
A muted yellow neutral face with a dotted or dashed outline.

An established comic book trope, dotted lines around a character can represent someone that is invisible or hidden. It can also represent smallness, submissiveness, isolation, and depression.

This emoji has the same expression as ğŸ˜ Neutral Face.

title: Face with Diagonal Mouth
description: A yellow face with a closed slanted mouth. Can be used to express skepticism, confusion, or frustration.

title: Face Holding Back Tears
description:
A yellow face with tears welling up at the bottom of its two large eyes.

May be used to express a range of emotions including sadness, anger, embarrassment, admiration, and gratitude. 

ğŸ¥² Smiling Face with Tear and ğŸ¥º Pleading Face can be used in some similar contexts.

Unlike other vendors, Huawei's design shows this emoji holding its hands expectantly against its cheeks.

title: Palm Down Hand
description:
A hand in profile with the palm facing down.

Can be used to represent the action of dropping or reaching for something. May also be used in a variety of culture-specific contexts including dismissal, negotiation, or as a beckoning gesture.

The design is a mirror image of ğŸ«´ Palm Up Hand.

title: Palm Up Hand
description:
A hand in profile with the palm facing up.

Can be used to represent the action of lifting, offering, demanding, or beckoning. May also be used to express a question or lack of knowledge.

The design is a mirror image of ğŸ«´ Palm Down Hand. The hand position is similar to the one in ğŸ’ Person Tipping Hand.

title: Index Pointing at the Viewer
description:
A hand with the index finger pointing straight forward at the person viewing the emoji. Used to represent the word and concept of 'you,' the second-person singular and plural pronoun.

This symbol is seen in art, advertisements, and military recruitment posters as a way to draw the viewer into the image they're looking at.

This hand shape is also used in multiple sign languages from around the world.

title: Biting Lip
description:
A mouth with the top teeth biting down on one side of the lower lip.

Used in romantic contexts to express flirtation or arousal. Can be used to express anticipation or excitement in general. Also may be used to express anxiety, pain, worry, or insecurity.

title: Person with Crown
description:
A person wearing a crown.

ğŸ‘¸ Princess and ğŸ¤´ Prince were added in 2015 and 2016, respectively. Person With Crown was created to represent royalty without being overly specific about gender.

title: Troll
description:
A green troll, usually shown holding a club.

May be used to refer to the fantasy creature. May also be used to refer to an internet troll or the act of trolling.

Apple’s troll holds a scepter instead of a club. Microsoft, Twitter, and WhatsApp's designs show only the bust of a troll instead of the full-bodied creature.

title: Lotus
description:
A pink lotus flower in full bloom.

May be used to represent beauty, purity, calmness, or serenity. 

May also be used along with ğŸ§˜ Person in Lotus Position to represent yoga or meditation.

title: Empty Nest
description:
An empty bird's nest.

May be used to talk about actual nests or birds. May also be used to talk about home in general or to represent phrases like nest egg or empty nest.

ğŸªº Nest with Eggs was approved at the same time and may be used along with Empty Nest.

title: Nest with Eggs
description:
A bird's nest with eggs inside.

May be used to talk about actual nests or birds. May also be used to talk about home in general or to represent phrases like nest egg or empty nest.

ğŸª¹ Empty Nest was approved at the same time as Nest with Eggs.

title: Beans
description:
Beans, as used in cuisines around the world.  

May be used to talk about food, flatulence (caused by eating beans), or coffee beans.

Also used to discuss money, counting, or a small amount of something. 

May be used to refer to the head. Additionally may be used with phrases such as spill the beans, full of beans, or cool beans.

title: Jar
description:
An empty glass jar.

May be used to talk about jars or anything that comes in jars, from pickles to condiments to jellies to sauces.

title: Playground Slide
description:
A slide with a ladder, as seen in children's playgrounds.

May be used to talk about children, parks, or playtime. May also be used metaphorically to talk about a smooth movement or action like the popular dance the electric slide or sliding into someone's DMs, usually for the purpose of flirting.

Additionally may be used in reference to something with a downward descent.

title: Wheel
description:
A wheel with a rubber tire.

May be used in reference to wheels, tires, or vehicles with wheels. May also be used in expressions with 'wheel' like third wheel or hell on wheels.

title: Crutch
description: A basic crutch made of metal and rubber.

title: X-Ray
description: An x-ray image. May be used to talk about x-rays or medicine in general.

title: Bubbles
description: A few floating bubbles. May be used to represent soap suds, carbonation, or an effervescent personality.

title: Heavy Equals Sign
description: An equals sign in the style of the already existing set of mathematical symbols âœ–ï¸ Multiply, â• Plus, â– Minus, and â— Divide.

title: Heart Hands
description:
Two hands forming a heart shape. Used to express love and support.

This emoji currently showns the heart being made through two hands being curved into a C-shape with their thumbs touching. This is stereotypically referred to as the "Millennial Hand Heart".

title: Pregnant Man
description:
A pregnant man holding his round stomach. Sometimes used in jest to represent feeling too full after overeating, as in a "food baby."

Variants include ğŸ«„ Pregnant Person and ğŸ«ƒ Pregnant Woman.

This emoji was approved to make the emoji keyboard more consistent and gender inclusive.

title: Pregnant Person
description:
A pregnant person holding their round stomach. Sometimes used in jest to represent feeling too full after overeating, as in a "food baby."

Variants include ğŸ«„ Pregnant Woman and ğŸ«ƒ Pregnant Man.

This emoji was approved to make the emoji keyboard more consistent and gender inclusive.

title: Rightwards Hand
description:
An open right hand facing right, so as to show the back of the hand with the thumb on the top and the pinky on the bottom.

This emoji was developed along with ğŸ«² Leftwards Hand to allow for the creation of ZWJ Sequences that depict ğŸ¤ Handshake with two different skin tone modifiers applied, one to each hand.

title: Leftwards Hand
description:
An open right hand facing left, so as to show the palm of the hand with the thumb on the top and the pinky on the bottom.

This emoji was developed along with ğŸ«± Rightwards Hand to allow for the creation of ZWJ Sequences that depict ğŸ¤ Handshake with two different skin tone modifiers applied, one to each hand.

title: Shaking Face
description:
A face that appears to be shaking from side to side with its eyes and mouth open wide.

This emoji finds its origins in the comic book and cartoon trope of a shaking face. It can be used to express shaking from external forces like earthquakes, loud noises, or dinosaurs walking nearby. It can also be used to express shaking caused by strong emotions such as shock, fear, confusion, disbelief, anticipation, and excitement. Additionally it can represent dizziness, double takes, or double vision.

title: Light Blue Heart
description: A light blue heart, frequently used alongside other hearts. Used to represent love, friendship, feelings of warmth, and the color blue.

title: Grey Heart
description: A grey heart, frequently used alongside other hearts. Used to represent love, friendship, feelings of warmth, and the color grey.

title: Pink Heart
description:
A plain pink heart, expected to be frequently used alongside other hearts. Used to represent love, friendship, and feelings of warmth, and the color pink.

For many years before its introduction in 2022, the plain pink heart was one of the world's most frequently requested emojis.

On several platforms, pink hearts are used in the design of other emojis. These emoji include: Sparkling Heart ğŸ’–, Two Hearts ğŸ’•, Growing Heart ğŸ’—, Beating Heart ğŸ’“, Revolving Heart ğŸ’, Heart with Arrow ğŸ’˜, Heart with Ribbon ğŸ’, and Kiss ğŸ’.

title: Rightwards Pushing Hand
description:
A profile of an open hand pushing or positioned with the palm toward the right. 

May be used to show a hand pushing something away or to represent rejection of something in general. May also be used with with ğŸ«· Leftwards Pushing Hand to show hands high fiving or holding, pressing, or squishing something.

title: Leftwards Pushing Hand
description:
A profile of an open hand pushing or positioned with the palm toward the left. 

May be used to show a hand pushing something away or to represent rejection of something in general. May also be used with with ğŸ«¸ Rightwards Pushing Hand to show hands high fiving or holding, pressing, or squishing something.

title: Moose
description:
A moose head with large antlers.

Can be used to talk about the actual animal. Can also be used to represent countries including Canada and Sweden, where the moose is considered a national symbol. Can also be used alongside the phrase "cool as a moose."

Google’s Moose is facing left, while Twitter displays a full-bodied moose

title: Donkey
description:
A grey donkey or mule, shown in full profile, sometimes with its hind legs kicking into the air.

Can be used literally to represent the pack animal. Can also be used metaphorically to call someone a jackass or to say that someone is stubborn as a mule.

Because the donkey is a symbol of the Democratic Party of the United States, it may be used in political contexts. Additionally, the term mule can refer to someone who carries illegal drugs across borders, so this emoji may be used to talk about smugglers and the act of smuggling.

title: Wing
description:
A single white wing with feathers. 

Can be used to talk about flying, both literally and metaphorical. May be used in phrases such as when pigs fly or time flies. May also be used to talk about angels or to say that someone or something is angelic.

title: Goose
description:
A white goose in full profile. 

Can be used to talk about the actual animal. Can also be used in the context of idioms including silly goose, wild goose chase, or what's good for the goose is good for the gander. Can also be used to talk about goosebumps or goose pimples. 

Might be used in reference to the children's game duck duck goose.

title: Jellyfish
description: A brightly colored jellyfish with a domed bell and dangling tentacles.

title: Hyacinth
description:
A hyacinth with purple blossoms and a green stem.
